issueDTO.title: [DAG] combineVSelectWithAllOnesOrZeros - missing freeze
issueDTO.description:
With #145298 we forgot to ensure that the selected operand was frozen - see foldVSelectToSignBitSplatMask for reference

I've included the alive2 for the `select Cond, -1, x ??? or Cond, x` fold here: https://alive2.llvm.org/ce/z/fwT9Si - but you should confirm the other 2 folds require this as well.

CC @woruyu
comments:
Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.


@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

Author: Simon Pilgrim (RKSimon)

<details>
With #<!-- -->145298 we forgot to ensure that the selected operand was frozen - see foldVSelectToSignBitSplatMask for reference

I've included the alive2 for the `select Cond, -1, x ??? or Cond, x` fold here: https://alive2.llvm.org/ce/z/fwT9Si - but you should confirm the other 2 folds require this as well.

CC @<!-- -->woruyu
</details>

issueDTO.title: Need Strimzi in the e2e helper file an version update?
issueDTO.description:
We are currently using some older strimzi version `0.35.0` for the e2e test:

https://github.com/kedacore/keda/blob/1d5f3c56a6812cbf387eb24b1bcabae9dee122a8/tests/helper/helper.go#L66

For those using a newer Kubernetes version (e.g. locally), setup_test.go (TestSetUpStrimzi) will likely not work due to compatibility issues.

Is it an idea to update this and if so, which version do we prefer?
comments:
Good point, to the lastest Strimzi.

Actually this is a good first issue for newcomers, I will mark it so
@adity1raut, is this something you like to work on?
Yes, I???d like to work on this. Please assign it to me.

Hey @zroubalik,

For Kubernetes **v1.25+**, I recommend upgrading our tests to **Strimzi??0.47.0**???it???s stable and production???ready. A few key changes to note:

* **KRaft mode:** As of Strimzi??0.46, ZooKeeper support has been removed. Kafka must now run in KRaft mode.
* **MirrorMaker??1:** Deprecated and no longer supported.
* **CR updates:** Ensure any test custom resources reflect the new API versions.

Looking further ahead, environments running Kubernetes **v1.27+** will require **Strimzi??0.48.x** or newer.

Currently, our E2E tests reference Strimzi??0.35.0 in `keda/tests/helper/helper.go:66`:

```go
StrimziVersion = "0.35.0"
```

This may break on modern clusters (e.g., in `TestSetUpStrimzi`).

**Proposal:**

* Bump to **0.47.0** as our baseline in tests.
* Plan for **0.48.x** once we start validating in Kubernetes??v1.27 environments.

**References:**

* [[Strimzi??0.47.0 Release Notes](https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi-kafka-operator/releases)](https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi-kafka-operator/releases)
* [[KRaft migration changes](https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi-kafka-operator/releases#:~:text=,KRaft%20migration%20has%20been%20removed)](https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi-kafka-operator/releases#:~:text=,KRaft%20migration%20has%20been%20removed)
* [[ZooKeeper deprecation](https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi-kafka-operator/releases#:~:text=%2A%20Support%20for%20ZooKeeper,46%20or%20newer)](https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi-kafka-operator/releases#:~:text=%2A%20Support%20for%20ZooKeeper,46%20or%20newer)
I would go for `0.47.0`, because that is the latest stable release.

@rickbrouwer  I agree ??? I???d also go with 0.47.0 since it???s the latest stable release and fully compatible with Kubernetes 1.25+. It includes important updates like KRaft mode support and deprecates older components such as MirrorMaker 1.

Let???s proceed with updating to this version in the tests.

issueDTO.title: [HxInputNumber] No binding update options
issueDTO.description: `HxInputText` has a `BindEvent` property that can be used to indicate how often the binding should be updated during typing. The `HxInputNumber` control has no such binding, and needs one.

This is not currently a priority for us, but it's a #good-first-issue for anyone interested in contributing. The implementation will be similar to what we have in `HxInputText`.

issueDTO.title: Confusing SWT Style Bits in CSS Spy
issueDTO.description:
![image](https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde/assets/44021373/996918d4-5498-4737-8e74-0b244809668a)

The **CSS Rules** section of **CSS Spy** shows the current **SWT Style Bits** for the selected control, but it seems to contain a lot of useless information, such as styles that are not currently supported by the selected control (e.g. `SWT.RADIO` here), and bits that are not styles (e.g. `SWT.ERROR_MENU_NOT_POP_UP` here). Why is it designed this way, and what is the use of these ?
comments:
The filter should display the correct styles bits as described in this page : 
https://wiki.eclipse.org/SWT_Widget_Style_Bits

I think the idea is to remind what could be used on this widget... but ...as we are in a dynamic display,  it would be better to display in bold if the style bit is set and in normal fond if not set. Using the Widget.getStyle() method that would be easy to do. 

-> Good first issue

I am working on this! 
- CodeDay Student.
I'm working on this

> I'm working on this

Welcome, I assume you are a student from CodeDays, aren't you? The following pages should help you to get started:
- https://github.com/eclipse-ide/
- https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde?tab=readme-ov-file#how-to-contribute

and if you have further questions, don't hesitate to ask, we are here to help.

Hey guys, I'm working on this issue in a group with ahenden13. We were wondering if anybody has thoughts on how we should format the display, as there is a lot of unhelpful information. 

We are inclined to just remove these useless bits, but we could also just remove the error bits, leave everything and bold the set bits, etc. If anyone has any input it would be appreciated!

I think the main issue is that you can not know programmatically what styles a widget support at the moment.

So the first thing would be to have some declarative way (e.g. an annotation) to carry that information and update all widgets to use that thing before one can make progress here. Hardcoding the supported styles seem not very useful to me.

> What you are advising is we instead use something like an annotation.

I do not advise to use _something like an annotation_ but to use an annotation. e.g it could be a repeatable `@Style` with and int value and an optional String description. If we choose retention of runtime that information could be easily queried by tools (even e.g. in autocompletion or validation) to learn about valid styles what currently is only documented in the javadoc (and sadly even only in the class description and not at the constructor).

> The downside to this function is that it uses a lot of long if...else statements to manually grab the set style bits one by one, with hardcoded styles.

The most limiting factor is that there is literally no way for it to be used with custom widgets outside of what we know at platform / SWT.

Hello @laeubi, @akurtakov, @HannesWell, @iloveeclipse, @vogella

Just following up on the approach we shared above; we???d love your input to keep us aligned with your vision of the ideal issue solution. 

Does this way of defining our style annotations make sense, and should we attach these annotations in the SWT repository or just create wrapper classes in Eclipse PDE?

Thank you for your time and guidance!

issueDTO.title: Consecutive numbering fails
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Instead of getting consecutive numbering in different lines (1. 2. 3.) it stays at "1." (1. 1. 1.).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '[...](https://yopad.eu/p)' or a similiar etherpad instance
2. Create a Standard Bulletpoint and write something in the line
3. Press Enter to get to the next line and press Tab once to create a sub-bullet point
4. Now enter the next line without pressing Enter and write something down
5. Mark this line and activate numbering


**Expected behavior**
If you now press enter for the next line the numbering stays at "1." instead of going to "2.". This continues to happen in every other line you create under this.


**Server (please complete the following information):**
 - Etherpad version:
 - OS: [e.g., Ubuntu 20.04]
 - Node.js version (`node --version`):
 - npm version (`npm --version`):
 - Is the server free of plugins: 

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10 
 - 19041.1.amd64fre.vb_release.191206-1406 10.0.0.0.2.101
 - Browser Google Chrome, 115.0.5790.32, Google LLC, CHROME.EXE, CHROME.EXE

Thanks for clarifying @JohnMcLear. Here's a quick test I whipped up to repro in develop. ```.patch diff --git a/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts b/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts index 04e996e..435a3c7 100644 --- a/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts +++ b/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts @@ -107,3 +107,36 @@ test.describe('ordered_list.js', function () { await expect(padBody.locator('div').first().locator('.list-number2')).toHaveCount(1) }); }); + +test('issue 5718 stops numbering OLs after ULs', async function ({page}) { + + const padBody = await getPadBody(page); + await clearPadContent(page) + + await writeToPad(page, 'Line 1') + await page.keyboard.press('Enter') + await writeToPad(page, 'Line 2') + await page.keyboard.press('Enter') + await writeToPad(page, 'Line 3') + + const $insertunorderedlistButton = page.locator('.buttonicon-insertunorderedlist') + const $insertorderedlistButton = page.locator('.buttonicon-insertorderedlist') + + const firstLine = padBody.locator('div').nth(7) + const secondLine = padBody.locator('div').nth(8) + const thirdLine = padBody.locator('div').nth(9) + + await firstLine.selectText() + await $insertunorderedlistButton.first().click() + + await secondLine.selectText() + await $insertorderedlistButton.first().click() + + await thirdLine.selectText() + await $insertorderedlistButton.first().click() + + + expect(await thirdLine.locator('ol').getAttribute('start')).toEqual('3'); // This passes + expect(await thirdLine.locator('ol').getAttribute('class')).toEqual('list-number2'); // This fails + +}); ``` First, I don't know why, but `clearPadContent` doesn't seem to do anything for me. I just modified my test to deal with the default content at the top. Here's the result when I run it: ``` Error: expect(received).toEqual(expected) // deep equality Expected: "list-number2" Received: "list-number1" 138 | 139 | expect(await thirdLine.locator('ol').getAttribute('start')).toEqual('3'); > 140 | expect(await thirdLine.locator('ol').getAttribute('class')).toEqual('list-number2'); | ^ 141 | 142 | }); 143 | at etherpad-lite/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts:140:65 ``` And here's a screenshot of the DOM inspector on those two `ol` elements: Notice how the 2nd and 3rd list elements have `start="2"` and `start="3"` respectively, but both have `class="list-number1"`.

> Thanks for clarifying [@JohnMcLear](https://github.com/JohnMcLear). Here's a quick test I whipped up to repro in develop. > > diff --git a/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts b/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts > index 04e996e..435a3c7 100644 > --- a/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts > +++ b/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts > @@ -107,3 +107,36 @@ test.describe('ordered_list.js', function () { > await expect(padBody.locator('div').first().locator('.list-number2')).toHaveCount(1) > }); > }); > + > +test('issue 5718 stops numbering OLs after ULs', async function ({page}) { > + > + const padBody = await getPadBody(page); > + await clearPadContent(page) > + > + await writeToPad(page, 'Line 1') > + await page.keyboard.press('Enter') > + await writeToPad(page, 'Line 2') > + await page.keyboard.press('Enter') > + await writeToPad(page, 'Line 3') > + > + const $insertunorderedlistButton = page.locator('.buttonicon-insertunorderedlist') > + const $insertorderedlistButton = page.locator('.buttonicon-insertorderedlist') > + > + const firstLine = padBody.locator('div').nth(7) > + const secondLine = padBody.locator('div').nth(8) > + const thirdLine = padBody.locator('div').nth(9) > + > + await firstLine.selectText() > + await $insertunorderedlistButton.first().click() > + > + await secondLine.selectText() > + await $insertorderedlistButton.first().click() > + > + await thirdLine.selectText() > + await $insertorderedlistButton.first().click() > + > + > + expect(await thirdLine.locator('ol').getAttribute('start')).toEqual('3'); // This passes > + expect(await thirdLine.locator('ol').getAttribute('class')).toEqual('list-number2'); // This fails > + > +}); > > First, I don't know why, but `clearPadContent` doesn't seem to do anything for me. I just modified my test to deal with the default content at the top. > > Here's the result when I run it: > > ``` > Error: expect(received).toEqual(expected) // deep equality > > Expected: "list-number2" > Received: "list-number1" > > 138 | > 139 | expect(await thirdLine.locator('ol').getAttribute('start')).toEqual('3'); > > 140 | expect(await thirdLine.locator('ol').getAttribute('class')).toEqual('list-number2'); > | ^ > 141 | > 142 | }); > 143 | > at etherpad-lite/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts:140:65 > ``` > > And here's a screenshot of the DOM inspector on those two `ol` elements: > > > Notice how the 2nd and 3rd list elements have `start="2"` and `start="3"` respectively, but both have `class="list-number1"`. Brilliant work, thank you! @SamTV12345 I think this test can be included with a PR for a fix. :)

Dug into this a bit more today. I think the `list-numberN` thing might be a red herring. Instead, I believe it's the conditions that lead to setting `list-start-numberN` which are the real crux (see [this code](https://github.com/ether/etherpad-lite/blob/475456ec10705e7771dd488796a74acb5834411a/src/static/js/domline.ts#L109)).

I see that CSS is responsible for the actual sequential numbering, and it appears that this depends on having a `list-start-numberN` class on some numbered list element. This requires `listType == "number" && start == 1`. But if the first list element isn't of type number, we don't set `list-start-number1` on it, and so the CSS can't do its job. Here's an updated test case + video.


```.patch
diff --git a/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts b/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts
index 04e996e..5c24beb 100644
--- a/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts
+++ b/src/tests/frontend-new/specs/ordered_list.spec.ts
@@ -107,3 +107,34 @@ test.describe('ordered_list.js', function () {
       await expect(padBody.locator('div').first().locator('.list-number2')).toHaveCount(1)
     });
   });
+
+test('issue 5718 stops numbering OLs after ULs', async function ({page}) {
+
+    const padBody = await getPadBody(page);
+    await clearPadContent(page)
+
+    const $insertunorderedlistButton = page.locator('.buttonicon-insertunorderedlist')
+    const $insertorderedlistButton = page.locator('.buttonicon-insertorderedlist')
+
+    await writeToPad(page, 'Line 1')
+
+    const firstLine = padBody.locator('div').nth(7)
+
+    await $insertorderedlistButton.first().click()
+    await page.keyboard.press('Enter')
+    await writeToPad(page, 'Line 2')
+    await page.keyboard.press('Enter')
+    await writeToPad(page, 'Line 3')
+
+
+    expect(await firstLine.getAttribute('class')).toEqual('ace-line list-start-number1'); // This passes
+
+    await firstLine.selectText()
+    await $insertunorderedlistButton.first().click() // Switch first line from OL to UL
+
+    const secondLine = padBody.locator('div').nth(8)
+    expect(await secondLine.getAttribute('class')).toEqual('ace-line list-start-number1'); // This fails
+
+    // expect(false).toEqual(true); // This line wasn't supposed to be here
+
+});
```

issueDTO.title: Filename links in terminal should consider `pwd`
issueDTO.description: ### Summary When clicking on a file listed in the integrated terminal, it opens the file first associated at the top level of the workspace instead of the actual file. ### Description Steps to reproduce: ``` mkdir /tmp/issue34027 cd $_ zed . ``` In Zed terminal: ``` mkdir foo touch test.txt touch foo/test.txt cd foo echo "test.txt" ``` 4. Command + click test.txt -> this will open /tmp/issue34027/test.txt not /tmp/issue34027/foo **Expected Behavior**: Zed opens `foo/test.txt` **Actual Behavior**: Zed opens `test.txt` (not in the subfolder) ### Zed Version and System Specs Zed: v0.193.3 (Zed) OS: macOS 15.5.0 Memory: 48 GiB Architecture: aarch64
comments:
This makes sense.  The algorithm resolving which file to match should take `pwd` into account.

Of note, even this won't be perfect either, e.g. running `ls foo` from the project will still resolve to /test.txt not foo/test.txt, but I think considering PWD would be an improvement.
Very related to https://github.com/zed-industries/zed/issues/33498

## What should I do if I have a problem
1. Try to google it before asking. Googling is taking major part of dev work 
2. If you couldn't find answer your question with Google, text your question to [dev](https://t.me/spotnet_dev/4) group with your question.

## How to prepare PR
1. Check if your code [smell](https://refactoring.guru/refactoring/smells) good
2. Add `close #<issue number>` to link your issue with your PR
3. Do not commit changes that are unrelated to your task
4. Check after you created PR, if you committed everything


## Task Description
1. Set up backend part using this [README.md](https://github.com/djeck1432/spotnet/tree/main/margin/margin_app/README.md)

issueDTO.title: Refactor and consolidate all module inline data into a single method
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Description

Starting in #10165 it was proposed to refactor several methods that hook into the `googlesitekit_inline_modules_data` filter, so they are consolidated into a single method `get_inline_data` that will return all data in the single method.

For consistency, we should do this in all modules, and preferably enforce this as with an interface. We can create `Module_With_Inline_data` interface that will force adding `get_inline_data` method, and new trait `Module_With_Inline_Data_Trait` that will include `register_inline_data` method, which will hook into the `googlesitekit_inline_modules_data` filter and invoke `get_inline_data` method.

We can then refactor all modules to use this new interface and trait, and it should be used in all new modules that are created in the future.

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

* New interface `Module_With_Inline_Data` is introduced to enforce the presence of a unified method on any module that provides inline data.
* New trait `Module_With_Inline_Data_Trait` is introduced to include a registration method - which will hook into the `googlesitekit_inline_modules_data` and use the interface enforced method as a callback
* Existing modules with inline data should be refactored to use the interface and trait for consistency.

## Implementation Brief

* [x] Add new interface `includes/Core/Modules/Module_With_Inline_Data.php` 
  *  It should enforce `get_inline_data` method which should return an array
* [x] Add new trait `includes/Core/Modules/Module_With_Inline_Data_Trait.php`
  * Include  `register_inline_data` method which hooks into the `googlesitekit_inline_modules_data` and uses `get_inline_data` as a callback
* [x] Update following modules: 
  * `includes/Modules/Analytics_4.php`
  * `includes/Modules/Ads.php`
  * `includes/Modules/Sign_In_With_Google.php`
    * Each should implement `Module_With_Inline_Data` interface and use `Module_With_Inline_Data_Trait` trait

issueDTO.title: [DAG][ARM] computeKnownBitsForTargetNode - add handling for ARMISD VORRIMM\VBICIMM nodes
issueDTO.description:
If we fold to a VORRIMM\VBICIMM node then valuetracking can no longer analyse the known bits.

Noticed while working on longer term work for #83422 - I haven't created a test case against trunk, but its possible that existing test coverage might already benefit.
comments:
Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.

@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

Author: Simon Pilgrim (RKSimon)

<details>
If we fold to a VORRIMM\VBICIMM node then valuetracking can no longer analyse the known bits.

Noticed while working on longer term work for #<!-- -->83422 - I haven't created a test case against trunk, but its possible that existing test coverage might benefit.
</details>

@llvm/issue-subscribers-backend-arm

Author: Simon Pilgrim (RKSimon)

<details>
If we fold to a VORRIMM\VBICIMM node then valuetracking can no longer analyse the known bits.

Noticed while working on longer term work for #<!-- -->83422 - I haven't created a test case against trunk, but its possible that existing test coverage might benefit.
</details>
Hi @RKSimon, I'd like to contribute to this. Can I work on it please?

Hi @trnguyen34 , I hope you don???t mind me asking???are you still planning to work on this?
If you're no longer available, I???d be happy to help out. Totally understand if you???re still on it!
Hi @woruyu, I'm still working on it but I'd be happy to work on it with you.

Hi @trnguyen34, thanks for the update!

I???ve already posted a draft PR for the ARMISD::VORRIMM support in computeKnownBitsForTargetNode, but I haven???t found a minimal test case that clearly exercises the new logic.

One tricky part is that the immediate operand in VORRIMM is actually an encoded value, not the real splat constant. So to get correct known bits, we need to call ARM_AM::decodeVMOVModImm with the proper element size. Just using getConstantOperandAPInt gives the wrong result in many cases.

If you???d like to verify or experiment with this, the following function is a good way to trigger the pattern:
```llvm
; RUN: llc < %s -mtriple armv7-linux-gnueabihf -mattr=+neon | FileCheck %s
define void @test_v2i8(ptr %p) {
  %a = load <2 x i8>, ptr %p
  %tmp = call <2 x i8> @llvm.cttz.v2i8(<2 x i8> %a, i1 false)
  store <2 x i8> %tmp, ptr %p
  ret void
}
``` 
This will eventually lower into a sequence containing VORRIMM, so it???s useful for testing both codegen and known bits behavior.

Hope my suggestions and the draft PR help make the problem clearer and help you understand it clearer!

Hi @trnguyen34, form draft PR's review, maybe we need add a small test case in `AArch64SelectionDAGTest`.
Would you be interested in trying that, No pressure at all and I???d be happy to help however I can.
It shouldn't be in AArch64SelectionDAGTest - you will need to create a ARMSelectionDAGTest equivalent
I can try to add some test cases this weekend. @woruyu @RKSimon Do you guys have any resource that can help me?

Take a look through AArch64SelectionDAGTest and see how they did the various computeKnownBits tests in there. 

You will then need to create a minimal llvm\unittests\Target\ARM\ARMSelectionDAGTest.cpp file (and hook it up to the CMakeLists.txt etc._

issueDTO.title: [native] `GROUP BY` queries fail when session property `prefilter_for_groupby_limit` is enabled
issueDTO.description:
When session property `prefilter_for_groupby_limit` is enabled in Prestissimo, the following query with `GROUP BY` fails:
```
presto:tpch> select count(custkey), orderkey from orders where orderstatus='F' and orderkey < 50 group by orderkey limit 100;

Query 20250121_201500_00004_d38dh failed:  Scalar function name not registered: presto.default.$operator$hash_code, called with arguments: (BIGINT).
```


## Expected Behavior
```
presto:tpch> set session prefilter_for_groupby_limit=false;
SET SESSION
presto:tpch> select count(custkey), orderkey from orders where orderstatus='F' and orderkey < 50 group by orderkey limit 100;
 _col0 | orderkey
-------+----------
     1 |        6
     1 |        3
(2 rows)
```

## Current Behavior
```
presto:tpch> set session prefilter_for_groupby_limit=true;
SET SESSION
presto:tpch> set session optimize_hash_generation=false;
SET SESSION
presto:tpch> select count(custkey), orderkey from orders where orderstatus='F' and orderkey < 50 group by orderkey limit 100;


WARNING: Sampled the following columns/derived columns at 1.0 percent:
	orderkey from HiveTableHandle{schemaName=tpch, tableName=orders, analyzePartitionValues=Optional.empty}


Query 20250121_201500_00004_d38dh, FAILED, 1 node
Splits: 1 total, 0 done (0.00%)
[Latency: client-side: 0:01, server-side: 0:01] [0 rows, 0B] [0 rows/s, 0B/s]

Query 20250121_201500_00004_d38dh failed:  Scalar function name not registered: presto.default.$operator$hash_code, called with arguments: (BIGINT).
```
comments: It seems like this is because we don't know how to translate `$operator$hash_code` into the equivalent in Velox.  But this should be feasible, as obviously Velox is able to hash a bigint.  Isn't this a bug in the plan translator?

Ah well... This was a deliberate bug in plan translator. 

We generally preferred to use VectorHasher and Velox HashTable and avoid the use of hash_code as much as possible in Velox operators. At the time, the only optimizer rule we found using hash_code was to avoid re-hashing an agg post join, and Velox team was quite insistent that this performance is good out of the box in Velox.

The prefilter_for_groupby_limit is a very useful optimization and I have found it used in addition to all Velox offers to get good benchmark numbers. So I'm in favor of re-enabling it.

We just need to expose the right hash functions to map to hash_code (and we have added a bunch of them to Velox now). Re-mapping the functions will be sufficient to enable this optimization.
This should be straightforward, should we add the `good first issue` label?

> This should be straightforward, should we add the `good first issue` label?

That's a good idea. Done.
This is my feature :) unfortunately it uses a hacky "timeout" thing not sure if we want that in native. But I would love to see this working

> right hash functions to map to hash_code

IIUC, we just recently added xxhash64 (which is used in the join_prefilter optimization). So maybe we can use that?

issueDTO.title: `std::time::SystemTime` has nanosecond precision but Payjoin only sees u32 UnixTime second precision
issueDTO.description:
In roundtrip testing a new concrete `v2::PjParams` struct I realized `SystemTime` includes nanosecond precision. After serializing `SystemTime` into the `EX1` u32 expiration parameter, and deserializing back into the type that precision is lost and an `assert_eq` failed, raising this issue, since we are storing time as `SystemTime` in many parts of the `payjoin` crate.

It seems to me that encoding this information internally as precise as the URL-serialized representation would be more accurate. For this purpose we may even use [`bitcoin::absolute::Time`](https://docs.rs/bitcoin/latest/bitcoin/absolute/struct.Time.html). Other than accuracy, changing to a u32 UnixTime abstraction gives us the advantage that u32 would work in `wasm` where `SystemTime` is not available.

I think this may be a good first issue to start, but it might be tricky to get the ergonomics right to completely close this issue. We'd need to figure out what type (`u64`, `u32`, or `bitcoin::absolute::Time`?) to expose in the API arguments and across the FFI boundary even if the internal representation becomes `absolute::Time`. We may take a look at how conversion ergonomics from `SystemTime::now()` to `bitcoin::absolute::Time` (or similar functionality) are designed as inspiration.

issueDTO.title: CRI-O does not pass device fileMode to OCI spec, resulting in default 0666 permissions
issueDTO.description:
### What happened?

Hi,

I???m using Kubernetes with CRI-O as the container runtime interface and passing USB and other devices to containers using the devices field.

On the host, the device files have correct permissions (e.g., 0660) with specific owners and groups. However, inside the container (using crun as the OCI runtime), the uid and gid are preserved, but the device permissions are always 0666.

I opened an[ issue in crun](https://github.com/containers/crun/issues/1826), and the response was that the OCI config.json passed to the runtime does not include a fileMode field for the devices, so crun falls back to its default (0666). Here is an example of the generated config:

```
"devices": [
  {
    "path": "/dev/bus/usb/002/002",
    "type": "c",
    "major": 189,
    "minor": 129,
    "uid": 107,
    "gid": 107
  }
]
```

As per the [OCI runtime spec](https://github.com/opencontainers/runtime-spec/blob/main/config-linux.md#device), the fileMode field is optional, but when not provided, the runtime will use its own default (often 0666). This behavior causes all containers to have full read/write access to the device regardless of host file permissions.



### What did you expect to happen?

From what I understand, the CRI implementation (in this case CRI-O) should be responsible for populating the fileMode in the OCI spec if it wants to preserve the host permissions.

Could CRI-O be updated to propagate the device file permissions (mode) into the OCI config? Otherwise, this could lead to unexpected security and access issues inside containers.

### How can we reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)?

On the host node, set a device file (e.g. /dev/bus/usb/002/002) with specific permissions:

```
sudo chown 107:107 /dev/bus/usb/002/002
sudo chmod 0660 /dev/bus/usb/002/002
```

Deploy a pod that requests the device using the devices field in the PodSpec (via Kubernetes Device Plugin or static configuration if supported).

Inside the running container, check the device file permissions:

```
ls -l /dev/bus/usb/002/002
```

### Anything else we need to know?

_No response_

### CRI-O and Kubernetes version

<details>

```console
$ crio --version
[vagrant@node02 ~]$ crio --version
crio version 1.33.2
   GitCommit:      0da1b7c95fa3ec7cb83306a39724bf39e35033f4
   GitCommitDate:  2025-07-01T08:46:54Z
   GitTreeState:   dirty
   BuildDate:      1970-01-01T00:00:00Z
   GoVersion:      go1.24.2
   Compiler:       gc
   Platform:       linux/amd64
   Linkmode:       static
   BuildTags:
     static
     netgo
     osusergo
     exclude_graphdriver_btrfs
     seccomp
     apparmor
     selinux
   LDFlags:          unknown
   SeccompEnabled:   true
   AppArmorEnabled:  false
[vagrant@node02 ~]$ 

```

```console
$ kubectl version --output=json
selecting docker as container runtime
Client Version: v1.33.2
Kustomize Version: v5.6.0
Server Version: v1.33.2
```

</details>


### OS version

<details>

```console
# On Linux:
$ cat /etc/os-release
# paste output here
$ uname -a
# paste output here
```

</details>


### Additional environment details (AWS, VirtualBox, physical, etc.)

<details>

</details>
comments: We need to add changes to [this](https://github.com/cri-o/cri-o/blob/main/internal/factory/container/device_linux.go) file.

issueDTO.title: Add a @medic/constants shared library
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the issue**
We have a bunch of magic strings spread throughout the app.
One of the prominent ones being `mm-online`: https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Amedic%2Fcht-core+mm-online&type=code
This is not the only example. 

**Describe the improvement you'd like**
Collect all reused magic strings and add them to a shared library. 


### Good First Issue ###
Welcome, First-time contributor! Here's how you can succeed in this task.
First, some background. Shared libraries are those collections of code that are available to be used throughout the `cht-core`. They are located in `cht-core/shared-libs`. This task wants you to create another shared library called `constants` where all the constants of `cht-core` will be stored as a single source of truth.

1. Create a new folder in `cht-core/shared-libs` called `constants`.
2. Create a new folder `src` inside the folder created above with an `index.js` file.
3. Create a `package.json` file inside the `constants` folder. Add some mandatory fields like `name`, `version`, `description`, etc. Other shared libraries can be a good reference for this. Keep this file minimal.
4. Start adding constant values in the `src/index.js` file. Refer to this [comment](https://github.com/medic/cht-core/issues/9621#issuecomment-2464647266) as to what values are to be converted to constants. Also, you can do some research and add constants as required.
5. Replace the values in the code with the `constants` library values. The way to use a library from a shared library is:
    ```javascript
    const constants = require('@medic/constants');

    // use
    constants.a;
    constants.b;
    ...
    ```
6. After you replace a value in the `cht-core` code, with a constant value, be sure to run the tests to make sure that nothing has changed. The tests can be run using the `npm` commands: `npm run integration-all-local` for integration tests, `npm run unit` for unit tests and `npm run wdio-local` for automation tests.
comments:
Examples I can think of...

- `mm-online`
- `X-Request-Id`
- `_local/transitions-seq`
- `_local/background-seq`
- doc types, eg: `translations`
- doc IDs, eg: `service-worker-meta`

Thanks for adding to the list. I agree with all these suggestions. 
We also have `X-Medic-Service` header that we pass to haproxy in both api and sentinel. 
For doc ids, we can also make it return translation doc names like (code) => `messages-${code}`. 
Same applies to form names, other docs that have prefixes (`org.couchdb.user:`). 

I think we're going to end up with a sizeable list.

issueDTO.title: [ENH] Recognize DICOM files with identical filenames within different sequence directories
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### New feature

Hello maintainers, thank you for building a tool that makes curating datasets less tedious! 

I recently started to integrate nipoppy for curation and processing of imaging data, and I came across`"Cannot move file because it already exists"` error with the `nipoppy reorg` command. The DICOM files I'm working with are named identically across different sequences. For example, `sub-A/ses-1` have the following (partial) directory tree:

```bash
sub-A/ses-1
????????? S10010
??????? ????????? I10
??????? ????????? I11
????????? S1010
??????? ????????? I10
??????? ????????? I11
????????? S11010
??????? ????????? I10
??????? ????????? I11
????????? S12010
??????? ????????? I10
??????? ????????? I11
????????? S4010
??????? ????????? I10
??????? ????????? I100
??????? ????????? I1000
??????? ????????? I10000
??????? ????????? I100000
??????? ????????? I100010
??????? ????????? I100020
??????? ????????? I100030
??????? ????????? I100040
??????? ????????? 100050
??????? ????????? I100060

```

With help from @michellewang on discord, I was able to resolve it by renaming the files to be unique by prefix-ing the sequence directory name as follows:

```bash
sub-A/ses-1
????????? S10010
??????? ????????? S10010_S10010_I10
??????? ????????? S10010_S10010_I11
????????? S1010
??????? ????????? S1010_I10
??????? ????????? S1010_I11
????????? S11010
??????? ????????? S11010_I10
??????? ????????? S11010_I11
????????? S12010
??????? ????????? S12010_I10
??????? ????????? S12010_I11
????????? S2010
??????? ????????? S2010_I10
??????? ????????? S2010_I11
????????? S3010
??????? ????????? S3010_I10
??????? ????????? S3010_I11
????????? S4010
??????? ????????? S4010_I10
??????? ????????? S4010_I100
??????? ????????? S4010_I1000
??????? ????????? S4010_I10000
??????? ????????? S4010_I100000
??????? ????????? S4010_I100010
??????? ????????? S4010_I100020
??????? ????????? S4010_I100030
??????? ????????? S4010_I100040
??????? ????????? S4010_I100050
??????? ????????? S4010_I100060
```
I'd be happy to make the necessary contributions to the codebase to include this renaming feature if y'all think its a good idea. I'm not sure how common this issue is but our scanners at NIMHANS seem to be set up this way. 

Thanks! 

### Unclear documentation

_No response_
comments:
Thanks for opening this issue @Arshitha!

It would be great if you could make the changes and open a PR for this. The relevant part of the code is the function below, which currently keeps the same filename but I don't see an issue with adding subject/session IDs (apart from longer filenames but that is okay).

https://github.com/nipoppy/nipoppy/blob/7449c575f67e5bfce298c4ade5097af0e2ca8eb5/nipoppy/workflows/dicom_reorg.py#L84-L94

And then you would have to add/modify test(s) in [tests/test_workflow_dicom_reorg.py](https://github.com/nipoppy/nipoppy/blob/main/tests/test_workflow_dicom_reorg.py)

issueDTO.title: Scheduler still runs span cleanup queries when tracing is disabled
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Airflow version

main (development)

### If "Other Airflow 2 version" selected, which one?

_No response_

### What happened?

While further looking at https://github.com/apache/airflow/issues/53401, I am trying to understand more the spans and traces config. It came to observance that span queries are still happening although traces is disabled.

The Airflow scheduler continues to:
update span_status on dag_run and task_instance, and
execute, every scheduling loop, a query that scans those tables for
```
WHERE span_status = 'should_end'
```

This adds an unnecessary SELECT ???  every loop; on large task_instance tables, it showed up in `pg_stat_activity` with noticeably slow queries until we added an index on `span_status`

Impact:
- Unnecessary DB queries during Scheduler operations
- Performance degradation in environments where tracing is not used
- Missed heartbeats due to blocking/slow queries

### What you think should happen instead?

I was checking the latest main branch and noticed, for example, that the [call](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blame/912ccace3532e3c05a46f6a1cf9457c0de41db6b/airflow-core/src/airflow/jobs/scheduler_job_runner.py#L1280) to the `_end_spans_of_externally_ended_ops()` method doesn???t appear to check whether tracing is enabled in the config. From what I can see, the Scheduler calls this method unconditionally.

There may be other similar cases, but in general, it would be good to ensure that no span-related logic or queries are executed when tracing is disabled (which is the default setting).

### How to reproduce

1. Start up an Airflow deployment with the default configuration (i.e. tracing disabled).
2. Observe the database activity ??? span-related queries are executed during the Scheduler operation, even though tracing is disabled
3. If the task_instance table contains a large number of records, these span-related queries can become slow and degrade performance (until [this issue](https://github.com/apache/airflow/issues/53401) is addressed).
4. These queries can be easily identified in the query logs or by profiling the database.
5. Adding info logs to the `_end_spans_of_externally_ended_ops()` method would further confirm that it???s being invoked unconditionally (I haven???t tried this yet, but it???s straightforward to trace through the code and verify the call path).

### Operating System

Linux

### Versions of Apache Airflow Providers

_No response_

### Deployment

Astronomer

### Deployment details

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
comments: I guess this one will also help resolve https://github.com/apache/airflow/issues/53154.
Hey, I would like to work on this one if that's ok

The issue is reproducible by starting an Airflow deployment with default configuration and tracing disabled.

issueDTO.title: Gemini CLI often outputs a hallucinated file after using ReadManyFiles
issueDTO.description:
### What happened?

I'm not sure how other people aren't running into this, but in my particular project I seem to not be able to avoid it.

When the agent decides to use ReadManyFiles, the output following the tool is often a hallucinated file or a copy of one of the files read, in the form: 

```
--- <file name> ---

<file contents>
```

I'm assuming this is because the output of ReadManyFiles doesn't have any indicator for the end of the list of files, so the agent attempts to extend the list of files rather than processing the list to do what it was originally intended to do. At least that's the only thing I can think of that would explain this behavior.

### What did you expect to happen?

Should do whatever it was originally instructed to do after reading the files.

### Client information

<details>

```console
Running Task ID: 99a1150d-77f6-42d9-b09b-f01565575083

Task State: input-required

Model: gemini-2.5-pro 
```

Platform: Linux

</details>


### Login information

_No response_

### Anything else we need to know?

_No response_

Myself, I "mistrust" Gemini AI even here (due to my realizing a a complex interaction of Gemini Core AI "in the clouds" and Gemini CLI tools plus Allegory of the Cave scenario), so I have Gemini Core AI use `cat` and such once in a while on some files, so that "she" can see the light thereby.

issueDTO.title: Add async constructor for Materials with image textures
comments:
hello jjhembd
i am a beginner in open source world
can you please tell me exact location of code[related to this issue] in files
so that i can work on that

Hello @gaurav8y785675474,

The new function should be added to `packages/engine/Source/Scene/Material.js`.

Then search the unit tests for occurrences of `material._loadedImages`. That should be replaces with the async/await pattern shown above.
Hi, I???m a part of the Flagship program for JTC. I would like to work on this issue ticket, please! This is a great opportunity to test my abilities.
@wesleykebrown Sounds great!

I've been working on this for a while locally and wanted to ask some questions!

Questions I have for solution paths:

1. Could the tests be modified to use `pollToPromise`?
1. With the image urls, there's a nested call in generated functions from `createTexture2DUpdateFunction` ([here](https://github.com/CesiumGS/cesium/blob/main/packages/engine/Source/Scene/Material.js#L787C10-L787C39)]. When interacting with `_loadedImages`, this function's path can either be synchronous or asynchronous. The asynchronous path has potentially multiple `.then` calls, which is probably what's causing the test issue. For improving this, should this and its parent functions be refactored to have a split async/sync path depending on if there's a "url" passed as an arg to a constructor? This would be a lot of refactoring.
1. The variant of above is making every function async and returning the promise chains but that's even worse.

<details>
<summary>
Questions I have for code understanding in this starbucks (hidden cuz its like, optional and I'm fun)
</summary>

1. I've been reading the [coding guide](https://github.com/CesiumGS/cesium/blob/main/Documentation/Contributors/CodingGuide/README.md) & I wanted to ask where this `Material` falls in the range of low-level to high-level
1. From the coding guide, it suggests writing code similar to what already exists. Unfortunately, for the `fromUrl` results in the repo, they're wildly different implementations. Mine more closely resembles [the more recently updated one of them](https://github.com/CesiumGS/cesium/blob/main/packages/engine/Source/Scene/SingleTileImageryProvider.js), but it is postfixed with `Provider`, and I wasn't sure if that had any implications
1. I saw in the op the example fix has a parameter structure breaking with the `fromUrl` tradition: having `url` be the first param. Would it be ok to have `url` be the first param or was that intended as its considered `image` as a nested property within the `Material` spec?
1. Also looking at other implementations of fromUrl, they're all public. Since the intention here is for improving testing, would it make sense to break from that here and have it be private or no?
</details>

Thanks

we are actually facing a similar challenge, but in a custom material using fabrics. would your solution also work for this?

i hacked a quick prototype where i used an `imageLoaded` event that would emit on `update` for every loaded image with the uniformId. the benefit of this, i thought, was a) that i can change the uniform and wait for the new texture to be loaded again without having to create a new material and b) the code changes where minimal: a total of three lines. BUT, you have to actually call update on the material. 

maybe there is an inbetween solution that could take care of both the `await Material.fromUrl('my.png')` and `new Material({ fabric: { type: 'MyFabric', uniforms: { tex: myCanvas }, source: '' } })`.

If the only purpose of `Material.fromUrl` is to make unit testing easier, why don't we instead make some sort of `imageReady` flag and event that Material creators can listen for? Unit tests could enter a poll loop on the ready flag, or register a listener which performs the `expects` validation steps.

I could see it being useful in other places in the codebase to have a flag that indicates an image is loaded. On the other hand - do we have use cases where we'd want to asynchronously load an image from a URL?

This sounds related to (although not "the same as") the changes that had been done in https://github.com/CesiumGS/cesium/blob/main/CHANGES.md#1107---2023-07-03 . There, the move was generally to change existing cases of "ready flags" and events into actual promises, but no strong opinion on the `Material.fromUrl` case from my side.

I see. In that case, maybe we should just store an array of promises (of images to load) in the material class, and expose a public getter so that users can await those promises? Users can continue to make materials as before - via the constructor or `.fromType` - but can subsequently await the images loading.

We could also then allow users to (optionally) pass in functions to call on resolving the promise, etc.

> dedicated promises for each image sounds pretty involved

Is it? If the `Material` class holds an array of image promises that's gettable, couldn't the user simply `Promise.all(theArray)` to wait for all of them?

I'm not necessarily arguing against an async constructor, for what it's worth. Just playing devil's advocate to try to understand *exactly* what we want here, before wasting effort building something we don't.

issueDTO.title: Reorder pybind11 method overloads by likelihood
issueDTO.description:
## What

Re-order overloads of methods in pybind11 bindings (esp. for `Manager`) such that the most likely overload is listed first.

## Why

When given a method name and arguments, pybind11 will search all overloads linearly until it finds a match for the argument list. So having the most likely methods listed first is better for performance. Currently this isn't the case for most methods, which is a small pessimisation.

<!---
## Acceptance Criteria

An exhaustive list of falsifiable outcomes that define fully whether
this task is complete.

Remember to consider:

- Release note updates.
- Documentation updates.
- Additional tests or test updates.
- Impact on dependent repos.
--->
comments: I'd like to work on this next. Just opened a PR for #1437

> I'd like to work on this next. Just opened a PR for [#1437](https://github.com/OpenAssetIO/OpenAssetIO/issues/1437)

Great, thanks!  How familiar are you with the API? I.e. do you have an idea of which function overloads are likely to be used the most?  This ticket could be made more explicit if necessary, but if you're happy to take a stab at it then I'm happy to see what you come up with the in PR 😉

Not too familiar yet, but the ticket seems clear enough to get started and figure things out as I go. Starting with `Manager` methods that have multiple overloads, I'd use `grep` to check how each overload is used, then reorder them in bindings so the most likely overload is listed first.

>  I'd use `grep` to check how each overload is used, then reorder them in bindings so the most likely overload is listed first.

Unfortunately this won't work. The "most likely overload" is that which host applications that bundle OpenAssetIO are most likely to call, not the most called within OpenAssetIO itself.

IMO, as a general rule, in order of likelihood

1. Singular
2. Batch
3. Callback

then the Singular and Batch overloads are broken down further into tagged overloads

1. Default (exception-throwing)
2. Explicit variant (result object) returning
3. Explicit exception-throwing

Ah, that makes sense ??? thanks!  I'll do:
1. Find the relevant pybind11 bindings.
2. Identify methods with multiple overloads.
3. Apply your priority order for each method and within each group.
4. Reorder them in code.
5. Test to make sure binding are compile and tests are passing.

@feltech I???m in the middle of a cross-country move and won???t be able to fully focus on this for about 2 weeks. If that???s okay, I???ll pick it up once I???m settled. Just didn???t want to go silent.

@feltech just wanted to let you know I won???t be able to continue with this issue after all. Things have been extremely hectic with moving and school starting, and I haven???t had the time to properly dive in. Apologies for the delay, and thank you again for all your guidance earlier.

issueDTO.title: [Feature Request]: Use Dev mode storage services for storing the profile image in preferences page in DEV mode
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Currently, when user uploads a profile image in DEV mode, it stores in the local storage instead. This is raising code managability issues in the preferences-page component. 

### Describe the solution (or solutions) you'd like

The aim of this issue is to use dev_mode_storage_services, in backend, for storing profile picture in Emulator(DEV) mode similar to that of image uploading  in 'exploration editor'.

### Describe alternatives you've considered and rejected

_No response_

### Additional context

This issue is filed based on this [discussion](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/19529#discussion_r1486456555).

The code to be changed is in savePreferences() in core/templates/pages/preferences-page/preferences-page.component.ts -- ](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/19529/files/267540a7d4cbc69de0c1d71f663a97a9f11df3c1#diff-0178d27d866bd962c1b96dd07b0e3a0cc8216714a3c8344cea73c3e4853ced38). There should not be a special-case for EMULATOR_MODE.
comments: Can you please assign me this issue, I would like to work on it

@aniketmdinde  Per the guidance at https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#choosing-a-good-first-issue, please provide an explanation of what your PR will do (with names of files you're changing, what you plan to change in each file, etc.). If it looks good, we can assign you to this issue.

Please also follow the other instructions on that wiki page if you have not yet done so. Thanks!

Hi I would like to work on this issues.
Things to do : In file name : `preferences-page.component.ts`
In method  `savePreferences()` We will have to remove the condition based on  `EMULATOR_MODE`

Hi, @parasjain-12 Thanks for showing interest to solve this issue. But , can you also please mention how you plan to use 'dev_mode_storage_services.py' for solving this issue ? You can check how ImageUploadHandler in [editor.py](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/develop/core/controllers/editor.py) uses [dev_mode_storage_services](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/develop/core/platform/storage/dev_mode_storage_services.py) and this [discussion](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/19529#discussion_r1485011410) for reference.  Also please try for an issue which is not assigned to anyone. Thanks!

@saurbre this looks promising, can you share the logic that will use backend dev storage? Also take into consideration [this comment](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/19737#issuecomment-2027990037).

OS: Linux (Ubuntu)
Browser: Chrome v.138.0.7
RAM Size: 16 GB

Hello, I would like to contribute to this feature request!

So far, I have read the problem description, read the issue's discussion entirely, and made my own feature branch for the issue locally as per Oppia's contributor guidelines.

However, I'm currently stumped on what to do next. @HardikGoyal2003 @mon4our 

From what I understand:
- The goal for [#19737](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/19737) is to be able to upload and save a profile picture (as an Oppia explorations contributor / learner) within the dev server. 
- BUT, the purpose is to be able to upload it to **backend storage** rather than through local storage. 
- The files of interest:
  - `core/platform/storage/dev_mode_storage_services.py`  --> contains functions that emulate Google Cloud Storage (backend storage) operations (--I noticed they're similar to CRUD operations)
  - `core/controllers/editor.py`  -->  acts as business logic for Oppia "editor" view (i.e. page/explorations contributor _?_ ) on web app)
  - `core/templates/pages/preferences-page.component.ts`  -->  handles frontend presentation logic for 'edit preferences' page.

As a start, on my local feature branch, I commented out the unwanted code segments in `preferences-page.component.ts` that are meant to save images to local storage.

Any guidance for my next steps would be appreciated. Thank you!

@bayquen my advice to you would be to:

1. Investigate how we upload images in the exploration editor.
2. Understand what method from [dev_mode_storage_services](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/develop/core/platform/storage/dev_mode_storage_services.py) is being used for uploading images.
3. Understand how the [ImageUploadHandler](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/4c175f128d5e83578db80f7cd55a48402d7bad75/core/controllers/editor.py#L1359) has been set up in the editor.py controller and how it is using the method in the above step.
4. Use this information in the preferences page and see if it works as expected (You might need to create an ImageUploadHandler in the profile.py controller if it is needed).

@mon4our ( cc @HardikGoyal2003) Thank you for your quick input! I appreciate you.

1. The exploration editor uses the [ImageUploadHandler](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/4c175f128d5e83578db80f7cd55a48402d7bad75/core/controllers/editor.py#L1359) class from `editor.py` controller.
2. In `dev_mode_storage_services.py`, the [commit()](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/develop/core/platform/storage/dev_mode_storage_services.py#L57) method is meant to be used to upload an image. It takes in an image as raw data and its input filepath, then storing it by using an emulator of Google Cloud Storage (GCS).
3. However, in ImageUploadHandler, I couldn't find any method calls from `dev_mode_storage_services.py`, let alone an import within `editor.py`. Rather, the upload handler class defines a custom [post()](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/4c175f128d5e83578db80f7cd55a48402d7bad75/core/controllers/editor.py#L1409) method for saving an uploaded image with GCS?

4. So far, I copied ImageUploadHandler into `profile.py` controller along with its necessary imports just as another starting step for now (--committed within my local feature branch, from my forked repo). I might be getting ahead of myself here, though. Anyway, I can't test anything yet since I have no full solution to try out right now.

Please let me know if I'm on the right path or need any corrections.

@bayquen Good job on investigating this!

I did some checks of my own to help you out:

> In dev_mode_storage_services.py, the [commit()](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/develop/core/platform/storage/dev_mode_storage_services.py#L57) method is meant to be used to upload an image. It takes in an image as raw data and its input filepath, then storing it by using an emulator of Google Cloud Storage (GCS).

Correct! This method is similar to the `commit()` method in [cloud_storage_services.py](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/124d14f79b76f5dda0ffb0fa2cd9bc90906cc393/core/platform/storage/cloud_storage_services.py#L81)

> However, in ImageUploadHandler, I couldn't find any method calls from dev_mode_storage_services.py, let alone an import within editor.py. Rather, the upload handler class defines a custom [post()](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/4c175f128d5e83578db80f7cd55a48402d7bad75/core/controllers/editor.py#L1409) method for saving an uploaded image with GCS?

In [models.py](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/124d14f79b76f5dda0ffb0fa2cd9bc90906cc393/core/platform/models.py#L396), the dev_storage_services file is automatically imported when in emulator mode (basically the mode you'll be in while running the local devserver) so you don't need to explicitly use it.
You probably don't need to look into this further as we are sure that if we match the way images are being stored in the exploration editor, the dev_storage_services file will be used.

So now, you just need to implement a similar solution to exploration editor here.

> So far, I copied ImageUploadHandler into profile.py controller along with its necessary imports just as another starting step for now (--committed within my local feature branch, from my forked repo). I might be getting ahead of myself here, though. Anyway, I can't test anything yet since I have no full solution to try out right now.

You are on the right track! I believe you just need to find out what is currently occurring for the preferences page, remove it, find out how the [ImageUploadHandler](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/4c175f128d5e83578db80f7cd55a48402d7bad75/core/controllers/editor.py#L1359) is being used in the exploration editor (which you already might have), implement a similar handler for `profile.py` (should be mostly the same as the one in editor.py, but check for any edge cases just in case) and then use the new handler for preferences!

issueDTO.description: Adding a sort to the column will move the $0 values to the bottom Figma link: https://www.figma.com/design/Y1PWkuB8II5lxdDdUq67Aj/Electronic-Funds-Transfer?node-id=7475-2
comments: Hey team! Please [add your planning poker estimate](https://app.zenhub.com/workspaces/Pay-Team-Space-649992c7f903a02c9b33009f/issues/gh/bcgov/entity/27404?planning-poker) with Zenhub @Jxio @ochiu @seeker25
Going to give this one to Noor

The Figma design indicates that sorting by amount should be toggleable or allow returning to an unsorted state. However, the delivered implementation defaults to a sorted view and does not provide an option to unsort. Clicking the up arrow has no effect and does not change the sort order.

we agreed to just add it as a static sort, if we want to make it dynamic need a new ticket that's in the 2-3-5 range.
Would require changes on the frontend and pay-api to support ascending and descending. Up to John / Patty if we need this done
Edit: from previous discussion, we agreed only adding a sort to 'Amount'.

issueDTO.title: Some CLI options documented in the CLI docs are missing in node manpage
issueDTO.description:
### Version

24

### Platform

```text
All
```

### Subsystem

doc

### What steps will reproduce the bug?

Run `man node` and view the `OPTIONS` section

Compare it to https://nodejs.org/api/cli.html#options ([permalink](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/8b199eef3dd4de910a6521adc42ae611a62a19e1/doc/api/cli.md?plain=1#L55))

### How often does it reproduce? Is there a required condition?

Always

### What is the expected behavior? Why is that the expected behavior?

Whatever is documented in the CLI documentation should also be documented in the node manpage

### What do you see instead?

The following options are missing:
  - `build-snapshot`
  - `build-snapshot-config`
  - `disable-sigusr1`
  - `disable-warning`
  - `dns-result-order`
  - `enable-network-family-autoselection`
  - `env-file-if-exists`
  - `env-file`
  - `experimental-network-inspection`
  - `experimental-print-required-tla`
  - `experimental-require-module`
  - `experimental-sea-config`
  - `experimental-worker-inspection`
  - `expose-gc`
  - `force-node-api-uncaught-exceptions-policy`
  - `import`
  - `network-family-autoselection-attempt-timeout`
  - `no-async-context-frame`
  - `no-experimental-detect-module`
  - `no-experimental-global-navigator`
  - `no-experimental-require-module`
  - `no-network-family-autoselection`
  - `openssl-legacy-provider`
  - `openssl-shared-config`
  - `report-dir`
  - `report-directory`
  - `report-exclude-env`
  - `report-exclude-network`
  - `run`
  - `snapshot-blob`
  - `trace-env`
  - `trace-env-js-stack`
  - `trace-env-native-stack`
  - `trace-require-module`
  - `use-system-ca`
  - `watch-preserve-output`

### Additional information

They need to be added in the [appropriate node.1 section](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/8b199eef3dd4de910a6521adc42ae611a62a19e1/doc/node.1#L60).

https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/4b4aaf921fda21c329caf349b23c0620867e4e6c/test/parallel/test-cli-node-cli-manpage-options.mjs#L21-L60

issueDTO.title: Memory manager should not use `.equals` to compare objects
issueDTO.description: The `MemoryManager` is using a `List` which ultimately means that `.equals` is being used to compare values in methods such as `persist`. Instead, we should use an Array or some structure that uses `==` to compare values. This is because two Objects that are created, much be released independently, regardless if they are `.equals()` or not.
comments:
Hi @irbull !
I am a new open source contributor and would like to solve this issue, could you help me understand the issue better by providing some extra references ? 
Is this is issue open to contribute ?
Hello, Can you please assign me this issue.
Is this issue open? I'd like to make PR for it.
@irbull hey I am new in opensource can you help me how to get started with
@shivampapat  can you guide me on this I am absolute beginner in this
I've created a MR to handle this inconvenient https://github.com/eclipsesource/J2V8/pull/587 please take a look
please assign me this issue
is this issue open write now
Hi @irbull , I see that this issue is fixed in code. Can you please assign me a different good first issue, as this will be my very first contribution to open source. Thanks :)
Hey guys, close if is completed the task

Hello, is this issue still open?
I am an early open source contributor and I would like to contribute on this issue.
Please assign it to me.

Hi! I???d like to work on this issue.

Since the MemoryManager is currently using a List, it relies on .equals() to compare values, which can lead to unexpected behavior when managing multiple independently created objects that are logically equal.

To fix this, I propose switching to an Array or another identity-based structure (like IdentityHashMap or a custom Set) that uses == for comparison. This will ensure that each object is managed independently based on its reference.

Please let me know if this approach is okay. I???ll be happy to submit a PR

summary.otherNotes: The issue is fixed in the code, but there are still comments asking to assign a different good first issue for new contributors.

issueDTO.title: Suggest functions in imported modules with the same name as an unknown variable
issueDTO.description:
### Description of the Problem:
While working with Gleam version 1.0.0, I attempted to use a function to print a list of numbers to the console but mistakenly omitted the package prefix from the function call. Instead of suggesting the correct function from the imported package, the compiler suggested an unrelated term.

### Code to Reproduce:
```gleam
import gleam/io

pub fn main() {
  let numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
  debug(numbers) // Intended to use io.debug but mistakenly omitted 'io.'
}
```

### Expected Behavior:
I expected the compiler to suggest using `io.debug` or another relevant function from the `gleam/io` package since it was imported and contained functions for console output.

### Actual Behavior:
The compiler identified `debug` as an unknown variable and suggested unrelated terms, missing the opportunity to suggest the correct function from an already imported package.

**Error Message**:
```
error: Unknown variable
  ?????? /path/to/project/src/my_project.gleam:5:3
  ???
5 ???   debug(numbers)
  ???   ^^^^^ Did you mean `True`?
```

### Suggested Improvement:
Enhance the compiler's error suggestions to consider functions available in the imported modules/packages, especially when an unknown function or variable matches a name in those imports. This feature could significantly improve developer experience by providing more contextually relevant suggestions and reducing potential confusion, particularly for newcomers or in cases of simple typos.

### Additional Context:
This issue arose when I tried to print a list of numbers without correctly specifying the `io` module prefix for the `debug` function. The current compiler suggestions did not help in guiding me towards the correct usage of imported functions.

**Gleam Version**: 1.0.0
**Operating System**: macOS Ventura (Version 13.2)

![image](https://github.com/gleam-lang/gleam/assets/59015064/416ccaa9-f464-44dc-8230-fc01270b6d57)
comments: Good idea! Thank you

Hi @lpil and everyone, I'm interested in supporting Gleam. It's great to see all the work being done, and it's my first time contributing here. Could anyone help me get started and work on this issue? I think I need to make changes in `error.rs`??

Wonderful, thank you.

You'd need to find where the error is emitted and at that point look to see which (if any) of the imported modules have functions with that name with the same number of arguments. If any are found then you can add the names of the modules to the error and then when printing the error include them in the error message in some way.
Thank you @lpil and @shellbear for resolving this issue ! Good work guys !

Hi ! Can I give a shot on this ? I saw that #2715 was closed due to inactivity and it seems not that hard, a really good first issue to explore the codebase !

However, there has been a little change since Gleam v1.0.0 and I don't know from which version this behaviour has changed. When I try to run this program with Gleam v1.11.1:

```gleam
import gleam/io

pub fn main() -> Nil {
  // Works as expected
  io.println("Hello, World!")

  // Not working. Should suggest io.println
  println("Hello, World!")
}
```

I got the error about println not in scope, no more weird suggestions:

```sh
error: Unknown variable
  ?????? /home/raphrous/code/gleam/module_suggestion/src/module_suggestion.gleam:8:3
  ???
8 ???   println("Hello, World!")
  ???   ^^^^^^^

The name `println` is not in scope here.
```

> You'd need to find where the error is emitted and at that point look to see which (if any) of the imported modules have functions with that name with the same number of arguments. If any are found then you can add the names of the modules to the error and then when printing the error include them in the error message in some way.

I think this is the simplest (and maybe cleanest) way to handle this case. So, is this issue still relevant ?

Yup still useful feature to have!

> I got the error about println not in scope, no more weird suggestions:

The "did you mean" algorithm was rewritten, it avoids unlikely suggestions now.

issueDTO.title: $SHLVL starts at 2 and increases by 2 every time Zed is reloaded
issueDTO.description:
### Summary

$SHLVL starts at 2 and increases by 2 every time Zed is reloaded.

### Description

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch Zed
2. Open the terminal
3. `echo $SHLVL`
4. `workspace: reload`
5. `echo $SHLVL` again

**Expected Behavior**: $SHLVL should start at 1
**Actual Behavior**: $SHLVL starts at 2 and increases by 2 every time Zed is reloaded

### Zed Version and System Specs

Zed: v0.195.5 (Zed) 
OS: macOS 15.5.0
Memory: 16 GiB
Architecture: x86_64
comments:
I cannot reproduce. For me:
`echo $SHLVL` shows 1 for me on a clean startup via Finder.
`echo $SHLVL` shows 2 when I launch Zed via the zed CLI.

Then in subsequently increases by 1 every time I reload zed.
No idea why yours is spawning multiple extra nested shells for each reload -- my guess is that it's something related to the dotfiles in your shell.

I think this is probably harmless, but would be happy to review a PR which filtered/reset $SHLVL when Zed is restarted so that it consistently reset.

> No idea why yours is spawning multiple extra nested shells for each reload -- my guess is that it's something related to the dotfiles in your shell.

Interesting, this doesn't happen in Ghostty. I'll see if I can find a minimal repro that causes this.

To add some context: I noticed this because my prompt is configured to show repeated `???` characters in nested shells. In a normal shell with $SHLVL = 1, my prompt is `???`, and in a once-nested shell, it's `??????`. After a few reloads:
I just re-tested and $SHLVL went from 3 -> 2. Not sure if I changed something relevant in my dotfiles, will need to dig deeper.

repository.description: Code at the speed of thought ??? Zed is a high-performance, multiplayer code editor from the creators of Atom and Tree-sitter.
repository.name: zed

summary.main: The issue is that $SHLVL starts at 2 and increases by 2 every time Zed is reloaded, whereas it should start at 1.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is reproducible on a specific system (macOS 15.5.0) with Zed v0.195.5, and the author's dotfiles may be relevant.
summary.attemptedFixes: No specific fixes have been attempted, but the author is willing to review a PR that filters/reset $SHLVL when Zed is restarted to consistently reset it.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is reproducible on a clean startup via Finder, but not when launching Zed via the zed CLI. The author noticed this because their prompt is configured to show repeated ??? characters in nested shells. The issue is not present in Ghostty. The author's $SHLVL went from 3 -> 2 in a re-test, and they will need to dig deeper to determine if they changed something relevant in their dotfiles.

issueDTO.title: Inconsistent Symbol Use in XMIR: Allows Both `@` and `??` Instead of `??` Only

Currently, it's possible to do this, in XMIR:

<o base="Q.foo" name="??"/>

And this:

```
<o base="Q.foo" name="@"/>
```

Let's make it possible to use only `??`. Let's ensure XSD to check this.

The same is true for `^` (should be `??`) and `$` (should be `??`).
