issueDTO.title: Publish SNAPSHOT Images for Stable Branches
issueDTO.description:
## Description  

Currently, we do not publish SNAPSHOT images for our stable branches. Having these available would allow QA to run nightly cross-component tests against the stable heads. In the future, this would also enable running new E2E smoke tests, reducing friction due to integration testing at release time and potentially cutting down on most of the manual testing required during a release.  

The `stable/8.7` branch already has a SNAPSHOT image due to the new dual 8.7 and 8.8 release strategy, but this was implemented as a one-off and uses the discouraged `8.7.0-SNAPSHOT` naming. This ticket aims to extend that approach to all stable branches, ensuring that every supported version has a corresponding SNAPSHOT image available for testing.

## Expected Outcome  

- Each stable branch (e.g., `stable/8.6`, `stable/8.7`, etc.) has a corresponding `X.Y-SNAPSHOT` image published for each component present on that branch:
    - 8.5 and older only have Zeebe component
- Images follow a predictable naming convention (e.g., `8.6-SNAPSHOT`, `8.7-SNAPSHOT`).  
- The images [are documented](https://github.com/camunda/camunda/wiki/CI-&-Automation#available-snapshot-artifacts) for reference.  
- The CI pipeline builds and publishes these images automatically.  
- The approach is sustainable for future versions (align the existing implementation of `stable/8.7` branch with how it's done on all other branches).

## Open Questions

- What were the previous blockers to implementing this for all stable branches?
- Are there any concerns regarding support for these images?
- Should each product team handle their own SNAPSHOT builds, or should Infra own this process?

## Related Discussions

- [Slack conversation from March 19???25, 2025](https://camunda.slack.com/archives/C071KP5BTHB/p1742395590166449) (internal discussion on why we need stable SNAPSHOT images and how they would benefit QA).  
- Reference implementation for `stable/8.7` ([GitHub Issue #27193](https://github.com/camunda/camunda/issues/27193)).  

## Next Steps

1. Confirm the technical feasibility of extending the current `8.7-SNAPSHOT` implementation to all stable branches.
2. Align on ownership (Monorepo Devops team vs. product teams).  
3. Update the CI configuration to generate and publish the images.  
4. Document the availability and usage of these images.
comments: @cmur2 just confirming that this will be implemented for all stable branches? And do you have a timeline of when this could be implemented by?

> just confirming that this will be implemented for all stable branches?

I wouldn't see why not since the ticket description (which I agree with) states that explicitly:

> Expected Outcome
>
> * Each stable branch (e.g., stable/8.6, stable/8.7, etc.) has a corresponding X.Y-SNAPSHOT image published.

> And do you have a timeline of when this could be implemented by?

No, not yet, sorry. I acknowledge that this ticket is quite important but as visible on [this board](https://github.com/orgs/camunda/projects/115/views/1) there are other important topics that we need to do and can't keep pushing. I will see if I might have capacity in my personal backlog or if there is another team with capacity that can help out.

Thanks for the confirmation, that makes sense! Totally understand that there are competing priorities at the moment. If it helps, I'm happy to assist with any context or input needed to keep things moving, especially since this would have a big impact on testing and release processes.

Hi @slolatte!
Sorry for the delayed reply. As we discussed today, this task will be the next one I???ll pick up. I???ll reach out to you soon to gather more information once I have some time to focus on it.

Hi @slolatte! 

Before I move forward with the implementation, I???d like to confirm my understanding of the goals and surface a few clarifying questions to ensure we???re aligned on scope, naming, and process.

## Understanding of the Goal

The core objective is to publish Docker images tagged as `X.Y-SNAPSHOT` (e.g., 8.7-SNAPSHOT, 8.6-SNAPSHOT) for each supported stable branch in the monorepo, so they can be consumed by:

- QA's nightly cross-component testing
- Future E2E smoke tests during the release cycle

There???s already a one-off implementation for stable/8.7 that publishes a `8.7.0-SNAPSHOT` image, and I understand this:

- Includes Git commit metadata in the image (e.g., via git.properties or /actuator/info)
- Need to be improved by removing the patch-level naming (X.Y.Z-SNAPSHOT), which we now want to avoid

## Plan Going Forward

- [x] Replace X.Y.Z-SNAPSHOT docker tag with a standardized branch-level X.Y-SNAPSHOT tag
- [ ] Ensure images are published on every merge to a stable branch (TBD)
- [x] Maintain commit metadata in the image for traceability

## Questions / Clarifications

1. Just confirming that `X.Y-SNAPSHOT` is solely a Docker image tag, and has no relation to Maven Central SNAPSHOT artifacts, correct?
2. Is this currently limited to the monorepo (e.g., Zeebe, Modeler, etc.), or are other components like Optimize, etc. expected to follow the same approach for their own `stable/X.Y` branches?
3. Should a new `X.Y-SNAPSHOT` image be published:
   a. Every time a PR is merged into a stable branch?
   b. Or on a nightly schedule only?
4. What should happen to the previous `X.Y-SNAPSHOT` image when a new one is published?
   a. Should it be overwritten/replaced immediately?
   b. Should we retain previous images for some period (e.g., to avoid breaking a test in progress)?
   c. If a new image is pushed while QA is running a test on the same `X.Y-SNAPSHOT` tag, is there any expected coordination?
   d. Should we assume ???latest image wins???, and the next test will simply consume whatever???s available at the time?
   e. Do we need stability guarantees per test run (e.g., lock to the SHA/tag used at test start)?

Thanks in advance for the help!

I can give input on some of the questions from my POV:

> 1. Just confirming that X.Y-SNAPSHOT is solely a Docker image tag, and has no relation to Maven Central SNAPSHOT artifacts, correct?

Yup

> 2. Is this currently limited to the monorepo (e.g., Zeebe, Modeler, etc.), or are other components like Optimize

Optimize is part of the monorepo on newer versions (8.8+), hence the phrasing in the ticket description:

>> Each stable branch (e.g., stable/8.6, stable/8.7, etc.) has a corresponding X.Y-SNAPSHOT image published for each component present on that branch:
>>   * 8.5 and older only have Zeebe component

> 3. a. Every time a PR is merged (_a commit is pushed_) into a stable branch?

That would be in line how we do it for `main` (and people expect it to work like that here) and `stable/8.7` so I'd appreciate the consistency and staying with the people's expectations.

> 4. a. Should it be overwritten/replaced immediately?

Again yes from my side, since I'd appreciate that to have consistency with how `main` does it (and people expect it to work)

> 4. c. If a new image is pushed while QA is running a test on the same X.Y-SNAPSHOT tag, is there any expected coordination?

Docker caches images locally (on the same GHA run+runner only) so overwriting images in an upstream Docker registry is usually not breaking.

I agree with all of @cmur2 comments and just to add to that from a QA POV we don't need to retain previous images for any period nor do we need stability guarantees per test run. Please let me know if you have any other questions I can support with!

I am posting here my planning for this task then:

```
fi
```
to optimise-8.6

- [ ] Monitoring

Hey team,

As part of implementing the docker image tag change from 8.7.0-SNAPSHOT ??? 8.7-SNAPSHOT, I noticed that the old tag (8.7.0-SNAPSHOT) is still being used in many places across the Camunda ecosystem. Some examples:

- Integration tests (e.g., CamundaProcessTestConnectorsIT)
- Tasklist e2e tests
- Operate/tasklist clients
- Docker-compose setups
- Test `application.yaml`

If we just change the build & publish process without coordinating, all of these items will start breaking as soon as we have removed the old tag.

Before merging this improvement, should we:
1. Temporarily publish both tags (8.7.0-SNAPSHOT and 8.7-SNAPSHOT), to avoid breaking tests immediately?
2. Plan a coordinated cleanup after the merge, giving time to each component team update their references?
3. How long should be this transition period?
4. Do the teams have available capacity for that?

Please let me know how you'd like to proceed.

issueDTO.title: Available slots calculation issue
comments:
I have the same question.
```php
use App\Models\User;
use Zap\Facades\Zap;

$user = User::find(1);

$availability = Zap::for($user)
    ->named("Office Hours")
    ->description("Available for patient appointments")
    ->availability()
    ->from("2025-08-01")
    ->to("2025-12-31")
    ->addPeriod("09:00", "12:00") // Morning session
    ->addPeriod("14:00", "17:00") // Afternoon session
    ->weekly(["monday", "tuesday", "wednesday", "thursday", "friday"])
    ->save();

$slots = $user->getAvailableSlots(date: "2025-08-15");
```
Outputs:
```
[
    [
      "start_time" => "09:00",
      "end_time" => "10:00",
      "is_available" => true,
    ],
    [
      "start_time" => "10:00",
      "end_time" => "11:00",
      "is_available" => true,
    ],
    [
      "start_time" => "11:00",
      "end_time" => "12:00",
      "is_available" => true,
    ],
    [
      "start_time" => "12:00",
      "end_time" => "13:00",
      "is_available" => true,
    ],
    [
      "start_time" => "13:00",
      "end_time" => "14:00",
      "is_available" => true,
    ],
    [
      "start_time" => "14:00",
      "end_time" => "15:00",
      "is_available" => true,
    ],
    [
      "start_time" => "15:00",
      "end_time" => "16:00",
      "is_available" => true,
    ],
    [
      "start_time" => "16:00",
      "end_time" => "17:00",
      "is_available" => true,
    ],
  ]
```

Why are there two slots 12-13 and 13-14?

Same problem here, it doesn't seem to work at all.

Even if the day of the week is not included at all, all slots are shown as available.
gonna check that and fix it ASAP

I think there is a misinterpretation: `getAvailableSlots()` doesn't look for schedules with "availability" type, instead looks for timeframes without schedules that prevent overlaps.

I think you can achieve the result by searching for "availability" schedules instead, specifically via the `availabilitySchedules()` relationship offered by the `HasSchedules` trait.

The user also provides a second example where they get multiple slots between 12:00 - 13:00 and 13:00 - 14:00. The issue seems to be related to the `getAvailableSlots()` method not considering availability schedules.

issueDTO.title: Hud fov.
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Since we already have FOV option as setting, possibly adding HUD fov would be great addition. Default COP rates are not best thing you can see here combined with high weapon recoil.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

- Just adding hud FOV setting in menu
- Main problem is that hud_fov cmd expects values in range 0...1, not 0...100. Probably console command should be updated to expect different range of numbers
- With default settings some values above .7-.75 are cutting off hud rendering (usually stock).  Changing `src/xrEngine/device.h`  `#define VIEWPORT_NEAR 0.2f` to `#define VIEWPORT_NEAR 0.05f` helped me for most cases, but still  stock  rendering should be checked with extremely high FOV values near upper limits. + I am not also aware  which side effects changing of this value can cause
comments: I generally view this as a technical setting rather than user one. So I'm not against it, but I don't recommend it :D

> I generally view this as a technical setting rather than user one. So I'm not against it, but I don't recommend it :D

Nevermind, now I'm completely ok with this option.
Fix for this is included with https://github.com/OpenXRay/xray-16/pull/1676, so once that gets merged we can close this out!
HUD FOV is already in the settings, finally!

issueDTO.title: Claude Code Action Fails Due to Missing id-token: write Permission
issueDTO.description:
In [Elvan's recent PR](https://github.com/llm4s/llm4s/actions/runs/16412163467/job/46369538739?pr=107), the claude-code-action fails with an error when trying to fetch the OIDC token:

```
Error message: Unable to get ACTIONS_ID_TOKEN_REQUEST_URL env variable
...
Error: Could not fetch an OIDC token. Did you remember to add `id-token: write` to your workflow permissions?
```


This was from the work we did on Saturday to integrate Claude for automatic PR reviews. The failure here is blocking even simple doc-only PRs, which should not happen.

Observations:
The Claude code action is attempting to request an OIDC token but fails due to missing GitHub Actions environment variables.
The message clearly states the root issue: missing id-token: write permission.
Also observed: an additional "Bad credentials" error from a curl request, likely due to misconfigured GitHub authentication.

Suggested Fixes:
1. Update workflow permissions in the GitHub Actions YAML file:
```
permissions:
  id-token: write
  contents: read
```
2.Ensure any token-based API calls (e.g., with curl or Octokit) are using valid credentials or fallback tokens when id-token isn???t available.
3.Graceful fallback in Claude review action for doc-only PRs , consider skipping OIDC token if unnecessary.

Next Steps
1. Add the correct permissions to the llm4s GitHub Action workflows.
2. Confirm Claude action works on non-code PRs.
3. Consider fail-soft behavior or bypass for documentation-only changes.

issueDTO.title: The description of the More block is not clear
issueDTO.description:
### Description

The description of the more block reads "Content before this block will be shown in the excerpt on your archives page."
From this description, it is not obvious that this only works when the theme template shows the full content.

If the theme archive page (or a home page with a list of blog posts) displays excerpts, the content will not be split into two, 
and the read more link will not show. 
This can be unexpected for users, see [Trac ticket 52361](https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/52361).

Related documentation for the `<!- -more` tag
[Code reference](https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/the_excerpt/#comparison-with-the-more-quicktag)
[Codex](https://codex.wordpress.org/Customizing_the_Read_More)




### Step-by-step reproduction instructions

1. Activate the theme Twenty Twenty-One -Make sure that the default customizer settings are used, and that the front page is set to display the latest posts.
2. Create a new post and add a short paragraph.
3. Add a More block
4. Add two more paragraphs after the more block.
5. Save the post and view the front page with the list of blog posts.
6. Confirm that an excerpt is showing texts both from before and after the more block.

### Screenshots, screen recording, code snippet

_No response_

### Environment info

_No response_

### Please confirm that you have searched existing issues in the repo.

Yes

### Please confirm that you have tested with all plugins deactivated except Gutenberg.

Yes
comments:
I've conducted testing in WP 6.3.1 and Twenty Twenty-One theme, and it appears that the "Read More" link is now visible on the homepage, which displays the latest posts. However, the content following the "Read More" block is not being displayed. ![image](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/assets/25176325/d6cff6a0-8bb0-462b-b8c9-9835309ef009) However, on the individual post pages, I've noticed that the "Read More" link is displayed along with both the content before and after it. Is this intentional, or am I not using the "Read More" block correctly? ![image](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/assets/25176325/ffd5469e-9933-4d9e-8b87-e9c56ecc62d8)

Kindly use the support forum for Twenty Twenty-One for questions specific to this theme. https://wordpress.org/support/theme/twentytwentyone/ Twenty Twenty-One shows post excerpts in the archives, including on the front page. The **more** block is separate from the "continue reading" link that is shown after these excerpts. Twenty Twenty-One is what is called a classic theme, it does not use any blocks at all in its templates. Only in the post and page content, if the user chooses to use the block editor. So the only way to show and use the **more block** in the archives is to make sure that these archives show the full post content, not the post excerpt. You can do that by going to the Customizer and changing the excerpt settings: I double checked, because I don't use these blocks often myself: The read more, more, and also page break are three separate blocks that all do different things. The read more block does not break up any content. It is only a link to the post, and it is intended to be used in templates. Please see: https://wordpress.org/documentation/article/read-more-block/ https://wordpress.org/documentation/article/more-block/ Thanks for the explanation. Regarding the current ticket, what do you expect the updated description to be? https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/blob/537316ad5666c5574a4370c4f285e5f953315739/packages/block-library/src/more/block.json#L7 https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/blob/537316ad5666c5574a4370c4f285e5f953315739/docs/reference-guides/core-blocks.md#L410 Hey @carolinan , Thank you for raising this issue. I feel the description of the "Read More" block could be improved, as it currently only states: "Displays the link of a post, page, or any other content type." We should clarify that this block is intended to be used inside the Query Loop/Template. Additionally, for a novice user, it might be confusing that both the "Read More" and "More" blocks display the same "Read more" placeholder in the editor when used together. https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/18c4d686-fd4f-4097-b663-7f6e4504851f I believe we should refine the description of the "Read More" block, as it currently seems vague, whereas the "More" block's description appears clearer. I'd be happy to work on improving the description if you feel it's needed. Also, I'm unsure where to report this, but the images on this site appear to be broken and need to be fixed: https://wordpress.org/documentation/article/read-more-block/. Could you share some resources on where I can open an issue for this? Thanks! This is blocked because there is a disagreement on the design and its default text. A decision is needed before a code change can be submitted. See https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/issues/34419 Documentation issues are tracked here: https://github.com/WordPress/Documentation-Issue-Tracker Please refer to the documentation from the documentation team and reach out to the team if you have questions.

issueDTO.title: 'CAR' doesn't work as access mode
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
It seems like 'CAR' (TransportMode.CAR) and possibly other LegMode cannot be used as access mode to simulate kiss-and-ride trips. It seems to work the other way around as setting CAR as egress_mode successfully results in driving egress legs.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a transport_network instance with a valid OSM street network.
2. Create a DetailedItineraries where access_mode is set to be either 'CAR' or 'CAR_PARK'.
3. The default mode of WALK will still always be the 1st segment's transport mode

**Expected behavior**
I expect the best paths to have 'CAR' as first segment mode.

**Environment:**
 - MacOS Sequoia 15.5 (M3 Pro)
 - Python package source: pip
 - Python 3.11.0, Java Development Kit 24.0.1

**Additional Information**
It seems like the equivalent functionality in r5r works as intended, though instead of a separate _access_mode_ parameter, _mode=c("CAR", "BUS")_ must be set instead.

**Test data and/or script/notebook**
Jupyter notebook and test data attatched below.

[r5py_bug_report.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20442258/r5py_bug_report.zip)

.osm.pbf file was too large to upload, it can be fetched from [here](https://download.geofabrik.de/europe/estonia.html).
comments:
Hi and thanks for reporting this issue. I have quite limited time right now to take a closer look, but this is on my TODO list. 

In the meantime: Have you checked whether the travel times are the same than what `r5py.TravelTimeMatrix` would yield? (because the algorithm used there is different)

summary.otherNotes: The issue seems to be related to the 'CAR' transport mode not being used as access mode to simulate kiss-and-ride trips, and the equivalent functionality in r5r works as intended.

Right now it is automatically fetching users current location without asking for allowing Location permissions.

issueDTO.title: backend sanitization methods should return "reason"s along with the error code.
comments: @v0lkan !assign
@marikann all yours.

@marikann you might want to start updating entities here: https://github.com/spiffe/spike-sdk-go/tree/a51ef1e36f7917480c1c759e37bb5567bbed5d47/api/entity/v1/reqres

when it's done let me know, so I can merge them and cut a new version.

Then you can use that SDK version and add descriptions to the error messages.

Make sure that the descriptions **DO NOT** include sensitive information such as secret paths or secret values, as we would not want them leaking out in the error logs.

Our goal is to be helful for the sysadmin to root cause the issue, but not so much helpful that a hacker would use the same information to breach our security :)

Hey @v0lkan , sorry for the delay on this! I haven't had enough time to work on this issue properly. Could you please unassign me so someone else can pick it up? Apologies for not giving you a heads up sooner.

issueDTO.title: BUG: assert_frame_equal(check_dtype=False) fails when comparing two DFs containing pd.NA that only differ in dtype (object vs Int32)
issueDTO.description:
### Pandas version checks

- [x] I have checked that this issue has not already been reported.

- [x] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [latest version](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/whatsnew/index.html) of pandas.

- [ ] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [main branch](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/dev/getting_started/install.html#installing-the-development-version-of-pandas) of pandas.


### Reproducible Example

```python
import pandas as pd
from pandas.testing import assert_frame_equal

df1 = pd.DataFrame(
    {
        "x": pd.Series([pd.NA], dtype="Int32"),
    }
)
df2 = pd.DataFrame(
    {
        "x": pd.Series([pd.NA], dtype="object"),
    }
)

assert_frame_equal(df1, df2, check_dtype=False) # fails, but should succeed
```

### Issue Description

Output of the above example:

```
AssertionError: DataFrame.iloc[:, 0] (column name="x") are different

DataFrame.iloc[:, 0] (column name="x") values are different (100.0 %)
[index]: [0]
[left]:  [nan]
[right]: [<NA>]
```

When comparing DataFrames containing `pd.NA` using `check_dtype=False`, the test incorrectly fails despite the only difference being the dtype (Int32 vs object).

Note that the values in the dataframe really are the same:

```
print(type(df1["x"][0])) # prints <class 'pandas._libs.missing.NAType'>
print(type(df2["x"][0])) # prints <class 'pandas._libs.missing.NAType'>
```

Related issues:
- https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/18463: Similar but "opposite": here the dataframes contain different values (nan vs None) which are incorrectly treated as equal. In this issue, the dataframes contain equal values which are incorrectly treated as different.

### Expected Behavior

The test should succeed, since the only difference is the dtypes, and `check_dtype=False`.

### Installed Versions

<details>

pandas                : 2.2.3
numpy                 : 1.26.4
pytz                  : 2025.2
dateutil              : 2.9.0.post0
pip                   : 24.0
Cython                : None
sphinx                : None
IPython               : None
adbc-driver-postgresql: None
adbc-driver-sqlite    : None
bs4                   : None
blosc                 : None
bottleneck            : None
dataframe-api-compat  : None
fastparquet           : None
fsspec                : None
html5lib              : None
hypothesis            : None
gcsfs                 : None
jinja2                : 3.1.6
lxml.etree            : None
matplotlib            : None
numba                 : None
numexpr               : None
odfpy                 : None
openpyxl              : 3.1.5
pandas_gbq            : None
psycopg2              : None
pymysql               : None
pyarrow               : 19.0.1
pyreadstat            : None
pytest                : 8.3.5
python-calamine       : None
pyxlsb                : None
s3fs                  : None
scipy                 : None
sqlalchemy            : 2.0.41
tables                : None
tabulate              : None
xarray                : None
xlrd                  : None
xlsxwriter            : None
zstandard             : 0.23.0
tzdata                : 2025.2
qtpy                  : None
pyqt5                 : None

</details>
comments:
Thanks for the report, this would pass if when converting the EA to a NumPy array we cast to object dtype. I haven't looked to see if this might cause issues in other cases. Since this is aimed at tests, I'm wondering if changing to object dtype is okay here.

cc @jbrockmendel @mroeschke for any thoughts.

> this would pass if when converting the EA to a NumPy array we cast to object dtype

Yah I'm pretty sure that the behavior of `df1['x'].to_numpy()` casting to a float dtype was a much-discussed intentional decision.  Changing that would be a can of worms.

I'm inclined to just discourage the use of a) check_dtype=False and b) using pd.NA in an object dtype column (note that `df1 == df2` raises)

@jbrockmendel - sorry, I wasn't clear. I meant just inside `assert_frame_equal` to use `.to_numpy(dtype="object")` when `check_dtype=False` rather than just `.to_numpy()`. Agreed changing the behavior of `.to_numpy()` is off the table.
Gotcha, fine by me
how can i make contribution to solve this, can you please give advice to me? @iabhi4 @rhshadrach

Hi @venturero 

I already raised a PR for this based on the above discussion. You can checkout other issues from the `Issues` tab and follow the [contribution guide](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/development/contributing.html) to submit a clean fix for the issue you're tackling.

issueDTO.title: ValueError: You cannot specify both decoder_input_ids and decoder_inputs_embeds at the same time
issueDTO.description:
### System Info

- `transformers` version: 4.53.2
- Platform: **Ubuntu 22.04** Linux 5.15.0-139-generic
-  **Python 3.10.18** + ipykernel 6.29.5
- Pytorch 2.7.1+cu118

### Who can help?

@ArthurZucker 
@SunMarc 

### Information

- [ ] The official example scripts
- [x] My own modified scripts

### Tasks

- [ ] An officially supported task in the `examples` folder (such as GLUE/SQuAD, ...)
- [x] My own task or dataset (give details below)

### Reproduction

 I want to build a new MT model with  **bert-based encoder** and a **decoder from opus-mt-en-zh** (loaded as `MarianMTModel`), BUT when I execute `Trainer.train()`, It report ValueError: `You cannot specify both decoder_input_ids and decoder_inputs_embeds at the same time`. This is code about my model and trainer.
 Thanks for helping!

```Python
# ManchuBERT Encoder + Opus-MT-zh Decoder

import torch
from torch import nn
from transformers.modeling_outputs import Seq2SeqLMOutput


def get_extended_attention_mask(attention_mask, input_shape, device, dtype=torch.float32):
    """
    attention_mask: [B, seq_len]  
    return:        [B, 1, 1, seq_len] 
    """
    mask = attention_mask[:, None, None, :]        # [B, 1, 1, seq_len]
    mask = mask.to(dtype=dtype)
    mask = (1.0 - mask) * -10000.0
    return mask


class ManchuZhMT(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, bert, marian):
        super().__init__()
        self.decoder_embeddings = marian.model.decoder.embed_tokens
        self.embeddings = bert.embeddings
        self.encoder = bert.encoder
        self.decoder = marian.model.decoder
        self.lm_head = marian.lm_head
        self.final_logits_bias = marian.final_logits_bias
        self.config = marian.config

    def forward(self,
                input_ids=None,
                attention_mask=None,
                decoder_input_ids=None,
                decoder_attention_mask=None,
                labels=None,
                **kwargs):


        hidden_states = self.embeddings(input_ids=input_ids)
        attention_mask = attention_mask.to(dtype=torch.float32)

        extended_mask = get_extended_attention_mask(attention_mask, input_ids.shape, input_ids.device)

        enc_out = self.encoder(hidden_states=hidden_states,
                               attention_mask=extended_mask,
                               return_dict=True)

        dec_out = self.decoder(
                               input_ids=decoder_input_ids,
                               attention_mask=decoder_attention_mask,
                               encoder_hidden_states=enc_out.last_hidden_state,
                               encoder_attention_mask=extended_mask,
                               return_dict=True)

        logits = self.lm_head(dec_out.last_hidden_state) + self.final_logits_bias

        loss = None
        if labels is not None:
            loss_fct = nn.CrossEntropyLoss(ignore_index=-100)
            loss = loss_fct(logits.view(-1, logits.size(-1)), labels.view(-1))

        return Seq2SeqLMOutput(loss=loss, logits=logits)

    def prepare_inputs_for_generation(self, *args, **kwargs):
        return self.decoder.prepare_inputs_for_generation(*args, **kwargs)

    def _prepare_encoder_decoder_kwargs_for_generation(self, *args, **kwargs):
        return self.decoder._prepare_encoder_decoder_kwargs_for_generation(*args, **kwargs)

model = ManchuZhMT(manchu_model, chn_model)
print(model)

# freeze Decoder + LM Head 
for p in model.decoder.parameters():
    p.requires_grad = False
for p in model.lm_head.parameters():
    p.requires_grad = False
```

```Python
# Add LoRA for Encoder
from peft import LoraConfig, get_peft_model, TaskType

num_layers = len(model.encoder.layer)
target_modules = []
for i in range(num_layers):
    target_modules.extend([
        f"encoder.layer.{i}.attention.self.query",
        f"encoder.layer.{i}.attention.self.key",
        f"encoder.layer.{i}.attention.self.value",
        f"encoder.layer.{i}.attention.output.dense",
        f"encoder.layer.{i}.intermediate.dense",
        f"encoder.layer.{i}.output.dense",
    ])

lora_config = LoraConfig(
    task_type=TaskType.SEQ_2_SEQ_LM, 
    target_modules=target_modules,
    r=16,
    lora_alpha=32,
    lora_dropout=0.05,
    bias="none",
)
model = get_peft_model(model, lora_config)
model.print_trainable_parameters()
```

```Python
# Start Train!
from transformers import Seq2SeqTrainer, Seq2SeqTrainingArguments

args = Seq2SeqTrainingArguments(
    output_dir="./lora_with_bert",
    per_device_train_batch_size=batch_size,
    per_device_eval_batch_size=batch_size,
    num_train_epochs=10,
    learning_rate=3e-4,
    fp16=True,
    save_strategy="epoch",
    predict_with_generate=True,
    logging_steps=100,
    report_to="none",
)

trainer = Seq2SeqTrainer(
    model=model,
    args=args,
    train_dataset=tokenized_ds["train"],
    eval_dataset=tokenized_ds["val"],
    tokenizer=manchu_tok,
)
trainer.train()
trainer.save_model("./lora_with_bert/final")
```


### Expected behavior

I expected the script to train normally just as using `opus-mt-en-zh` only and get the lora checkpoint.
comments:
Hi! I had a look at your custom `ManchuZhMT` model.  
The `ValueError: You cannot specify both decoder_input_ids and decoder_inputs_embeds at the same time` comes from the fact that your `forward` always passes `decoder_input_ids` to the Marian decoder, while **Trainer + PEFT (LoRA)** may inject a `decoder_inputs_embeds` entry into `**kwargs`. When both reach the decoder, Transformers raises that validation error.

**Minimal fix in your custom model:** drop one of the two before calling `self.decoder` (keeping `decoder_input_ids` is the simplest). For example:

```python
def forward(
    self,
    input_ids=None,
    attention_mask=None,
    decoder_input_ids=None,
    decoder_attention_mask=None,
    labels=None,
    **kwargs,
):
    ...
    # Remove conflicting argument if both are present
    if "decoder_inputs_embeds" in kwargs and decoder_input_ids is not None:
        kwargs.pop("decoder_inputs_embeds")

    dec_out = self.decoder(
        input_ids=decoder_input_ids,
        attention_mask=decoder_attention_mask,
        encoder_hidden_states=enc_out.last_hidden_state,
        encoder_attention_mask=extended_mask,
        return_dict=True,
        **kwargs,
    )
    ...
````

After adding this guard, `trainer.train()` should run normally and produce your LoRA checkpoint.

If you prefer using embeddings explicitly, you could instead set `decoder_input_ids=None` and keep `decoder_inputs_embeds`.

Let me know if you???d like a small PR adding a defensive check on the library side; happy to help adjust anything if needed. Thanks!

Opened PR #39566: **Ignore `decoder_inputs_embeds` when `decoder_input_ids` are present**.

It adds a small guard in `Seq2SeqTrainer.compute_loss` and a test to prevent the `ValueError`.  
Happy to adjust if you prefer a different location for the fix. Thanks!

@JoseAlvarezMedina Thanks for your help. I edit my `ManchuZhMT` and add `kwargs = {}` (for debug). **However,** The `ValueError` still exists, So I found the code in `file transformers/models/marian/modeling_marian.py, line 992`: ```Python # retrieve input_ids and inputs_embeds if (input_ids is None) ^ (inputs_embeds is not None): raise ValueError("You cannot specify both decoder_input_ids and decoder_inputs_embeds at the same time") elif input_ids is not None: input = input_ids input_shape = input.shape input_ids = input_ids.view(-1, input_shape[-1]) elif inputs_embeds is not None: input_shape = inputs_embeds.size()[:-1] input = inputs_embeds[:, :, -1] else: raise ValueError("You have to specify either decoder_input_ids or decoder_inputs_embeds") ``` By Debugging, I found that both my `decoder_input_ids` and `decoder_inputs_embeds` is `None`, as the screenshot below: So maybe the ValueError is caused by the process that `Seq2SeqTrainer` generate `decoder_input_ids`, or my JSONL Loader(below)? ```Python from datasets import load_dataset max_len = 256 batch_size = 16 raw_ds = load_dataset("json", data_files={"train":"train.jsonl","val":"val.jsonl"}) def tokenize(batch): model_inputs = manchu_tok( batch["source"], max_length=max_len, truncation=True, padding="max_length" ) with chn_tok.as_target_tokenizer(): labels = chn_tok( batch["target"], max_length=max_len, truncation=True, padding="max_length" ) model_inputs["labels"] = [ [(t if t != chn_tok.pad_token_id else -100) for t in label] for label in labels["input_ids"] ] return model_inputs tokenized_ds = raw_ds.map(tokenize, batched=True) ``` Is there any solutions? Thanks😣
Hi, I see this is closed! Has it been resolved?

@Rocketknight1 emm It haven't been solved yet, and I seemed to close it by mistake.

> Hi, I see this is closed! Has it been resolved?
Just took a look - this issue is quite difficult to resolve because it depends on your custom code, and so it's hard for me to figure out if it's a bug in our code or in yours!

repository.description: 🤗 Transformers: the model-definition framework for state-of-the-art machine learning models in text, vision, audio, and multimodal models, for both inference and training.
repository.name: transformers

summary.main: The author is trying to train a custom model with BERT-based encoder and a decoder from opus-mt-en-zh, but got a ValueError: You cannot specify both decoder_input_ids and decoder_inputs_embeds at the same time.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The custom model should not specify both decoder_input_ids and decoder_inputs_embeds at the same time. If decoder_input_ids is present, decoder_inputs_embeds should be None, and vice versa.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author tried to fix the issue by adding a guard in the custom model to remove the conflicting argument if both decoder_input_ids and decoder_inputs_embeds are present. However, the issue still exists. Then, the author found that both decoder_input_ids and decoder_inputs_embeds are None, and the error is caused by the process that Seq2SeqTrainer generate decoder_input_ids or the JSONL Loader.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about ValueError: You cannot specify both decoder_input_ids and decoder_inputs_embeds at the same time. The author tried to train a custom model with BERT-based encoder and a decoder from opus-mt-en-zh, but got the error. The issue is difficult to resolve because it depends on the custom code.

issueDTO.title: Cleanup and unify Verilog and VHDL bel files
issueDTO.description:
Most of the Verilog and VHDL Bel files need some cleanup.

We should: 
- Apply a consistent coding style.
- Remove commented code.
- Unify implementations and remove unneeded module instantiations.
- Check Bel Map
  - Config Access Bel Map is not working since the config bits have the same name as the ports --> Maybe also others? 
- Fix Latch in [BlockRAM_1KB](https://github.com/FPGA-Research/FABulous/blob/FABulous2.0-development/FABulous/fabric_files/FABulous_project_template_verilog/Fabric/BlockRAM_1KB.v#L45) (Verilog and VHDL)
- Run Verilator Lint on the whole fabric and fix errors. 
- Check DSP Bel [MULADD](https://github.com/FPGA-Research/FABulous/blob/FABulous2.0-development/FABulous/fabric_files/FABulous_project_template_verilog/Tile/DSP/DSP_bot/MULADD.v)  
  - Seems to support only unsigned logic, but has also signed extension? (Verilog and VHDL)
  - Should we add a disclaimer or change the logic?
comments:
Coding style probably can be done with (Verible)[https://github.com/chipsalliance/verible]. But we will need to customise it to make it fit for Verilog. 

Some extra resources:
https://github.com/chipsalliance/verible/issues/317

I personally use verible for verilog formatting and linting and it works quite nice for me, although on the linting side you see that it's made more for SystemVerilog and you therefore get some false flags. These can however also be waived in a config file.

issueDTO.title: Add URL Encoder/Decoder Toggle to be able to encore all
issueDTO.description:
The URL Encoder/Decoder is currently using the `encodeURI(uri)` or `decoderURI(uri)` function which doesn't cover `; / ? : @ & = + $ , #`.

This is to add a toggle to that Tool to be able to switch between `encodeURI(uri)` and `encodeURIComponent(uri)` also doing the same for decoding: `decodeURI(uri) -> decodeURIComponent(uri)` so it will cover those characters as well.

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/encodeURI
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/encodeURIComponent

issueDTO.title: Gradle Shadow JAR plugin overwrites JAR created with `gradle jar` task
issueDTO.description:
> By the way, does anyone have an idea, why we have two very similarly named JARs in the build/libs folder?
> 
> @maehne: You asked about the small .jar file in build/libs. That file seems to be built by shadow. Even if I make a regular jar with `./gradlew jar`, doing `./gradlew shadowJar` will replace the regular jar with the small one while creating the shadowJar. I don't know how to have it not do that. 

 _Originally posted by @davidhutchens in [#2224](https://github.com/logisim-evolution/logisim-evolution/issues/2224#issuecomment-2853023419)_

`gradle shadowJar` overwrites the JAR created by the `gradle jar` task. 

```
$ ./gradlew jar

BUILD SUCCESSFUL in 3s
5 actionable tasks: 5 executed
$ ls -al build/libs
total 47112
drwxr-xr-x@ 3 maehne  staff        96  7 Mai 14:57 .
drwxr-xr-x@ 7 maehne  staff       224  7 Mai 14:57 ..
-rw-r--r--@ 1 maehne  staff  23578519  7 Mai 14:57 logisim-evolution-4.0.0-dev.jar
$ ./gradlew shadowJar

BUILD SUCCESSFUL in 1s
5 actionable tasks: 3 executed, 2 up-to-date
$ ls -al build/libs
total 59480
drwxr-xr-x@ 4 maehne  staff       128  7 Mai 14:58 .
drwxr-xr-x@ 7 maehne  staff       224  7 Mai 14:57 ..
-rw-r--r--@ 1 maehne  staff       261  7 Mai 14:58 logisim-evolution-4.0.0-dev.jar
-rw-r--r--@ 1 maehne  staff  29417523  7 Mai 14:58 logisim-evolution-4.0.0dev-all.jar
```

After `./gradlew shadowJar`, `build/libs/logisim-evolution-4.0.0-dev.jar` only contains an empty `META-INF/MANIFEST.MF` file.

The original JAR file created by `./gradlew jar` is lacking a `Main-Class: com.cburch.logisim.Main` entry, so cannot be directly executed using `java -jar build/libs/logisim-evolution-4.0.0-dev.jar`.

It would be nice to find a way to either suppress the creation `build/libs/logisim-evolution-4.0.0-dev.jar` or keep it in an executable state.
comments: This [Stack Overflow question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70783680/why-is-gradle-generating-2-jars-after-update-to-gradle-7-3-2) might be relevant to resolve the issue.
I was looking at Shadow 9.0.0-rc1. This issue is fixed in that version.
@davidhutchens: That is good news! We can update once the Gradle 9.0.0 and Shadow 9.0.0 are finalised.
As @crossplatformdev pointed out with PR #2290, it is the Gradle release candidate upgrade that fixes this problem. But It has potential issues for us that I am looking into.

repository.name: logisim-evolution

summary.main: The Gradle Shadow JAR plugin overwrites the JAR created by the `gradle jar` task, resulting in an empty `META-INF/MANIFEST.MF` file and a JAR that cannot be directly executed.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The Gradle release candidate upgrade fixes the problem, but it has potential issues that need to be investigated.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue is fixed in Gradle 9.0.0 and Shadow 9.0.0, but it has potential issues for the repository that are being looked into.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to Gradle Shadow JAR plugin overwriting JAR created with `gradle jar` task. The original JAR file created by `./gradlew jar` is lacking a `Main-Class: com.cburch.logisim.Main` entry, so cannot be directly executed using `java -jar build/libs/logisim-evolution-4.0.0-dev.jar`. It would be nice to find a way to either suppress the creation `build/libs/logisim-evolution-4.0.0-dev.jar` or keep it in an executable state.

issueDTO.title: Ensure Windows Compatibility for Contributors
issueDTO.description:
We need to verify that the service works seamlessly on Windows, specifically from a contributor experience perspective. Most of the current development has been done on macOS, and we want to ensure following:

- The project compiles successfully on Windows.
- Developer tooling such as pre-commit hooks, OpenSSL/Cargo dependencies, and other system-level requirements behave as expected.

This helps avoid friction for new contributors when raising PRs or running development workflows locally.

**What to Test:**

Clone the repository on a clean Windows machine and:

- Run cargo build and ensure there are no OpenSSL or toolchain-related issues;
- Install and run pre-commit hooks;
- Validate whether any pre-commit hooks fail unexpectedly (e.g. line endings, formatters, etc);
- Check for any missing dependencies that should be added to README.md or a setup script.

**Suggested Fixes**

- Update the documentation (CONTRIBUTING.md or README.md) with required setup steps.
- Create a .sh or .md file listing all Windows-specific setup instructions.
- Consider adjusting the pre-commit config or adding OS-specific guidance.

issueDTO.title: "Show headers" collapses multi-line headers onto one line, making them not authentic and often unreadable
issueDTO.description: ### Checklist - [x] I have used the search function to see if someone else has already submitted the same bug report. - [x] I will describe the problem with as much detail as possible. ### App K-9 Mail ### App version 10.1 ### Where did you get the app from? F-Droid ### Android version LineageOS 22.2 ### Device model Xperia XZ2 compact ### Steps to reproduce 1. Go to a received email 2. Make sure fully downloaded ("Download complete message" if necessary; to avoid bug #5240) 3. Press the three-dots button for the menu 4. "Show headers" ### Expected behavior I would expect to see an actual representation of the headers, verbatim as they are present in the source. Similar to "Show original" in desktop Thunderbird. Specifically with: newlines still in place; fixed-width font for alignment. Because if I'm viewing the headers then I'm seeking accurate, unprocessed information. For example: ``` X-Spam-Score: 10.1 X-Spam-Level: ++++++++++ X-Spam-Report: Spam detection software, running on "xxxxxxxxxx" Content analysis details: (10.1 points, 4.0 required) pts rule name description ---- ---------------------- -------------------------------------------------- 1.4 MISSING_DATE Missing Date: header 0.5 MISSING_MID Missing Message-Id: header 0.0 DKIM_ADSP_CUSTOM_MED No valid author signature, adsp_override is CUSTOM_MED 0.8 BAYES_50 BODY: Bayes spam probability is 40 to 60% [score: 0.5005] 0.0 TVD_RCVD_IP Message was received from an IP address 0.0 FREEMAIL_FROM Sender email is commonly abused enduser mail provider [xxxxxxxxx(at)gmail.com] 1.0 FORGED_GMAIL_RCVD 'From' gmail.com does not match 'Received' headers 0.0 HTML_MESSAGE BODY: HTML included in message 0.1 MIME_HTML_ONLY BODY: Message only has text/html MIME parts 0.4 HTML_MIME_NO_HTML_TAG HTML-only message, but there is no HTML tag 1.0 RDNS_DYNAMIC Delivered to internal network by host with dynamic-looking rDNS 0.4 KHOP_HELO_FCRDNS Relay HELO differs from its IP's reverse DNS 0.9 NML_ADSP_CUSTOM_MED ADSP custom_med hit, and not from a mailing list 0.4 RCVD_IN_XBL RBL: Received via a relay in Spamhaus XBL [34.141.xx.xx listed in zen.spamhaus.org] 3.3 RCVD_IN_SBL_CSS RBL: Received via a relay in Spamhaus SBL-CSS [34.141.xx.xx listed in zen.spamhaus.org] X-Spam-Flag: YES ``` ### Actual behavior The headers get collapsed onto one line: ### Logs _No response_
comments:
Hi @hills,

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We understand that the current implementation of "Show headers" can feel somewhat cluttered due to the "key: value" format we use. However, reworking this screen is not currently on our roadmap.

To workaround this issue until we have time to rework the screen, as a good first issue, we can add a padding between each header item so it will enhance the headers' readability.

We could also explore using some indent for the header's value, however, we need to take into consideration the several device widths we support.

Thanks for your proactive reply! I think your suggestion would not get to the essence of the requirement, so let me also try to help.

Here, "readability" is not about aesthetics such as indentation or line spacing, but about an authentic display of the headers for debugging purposes. The milestone is that ```X-Spam-Report``` is readable.

I've learned something from your reply, especially when combined with #5240. That the "Show headers" is working with internal key-values. They have already been parsed and processed.

Now I understand that, I would suggest not making tweaks or complexity; I don't think it adds any value.

The reality is much simpler: viewing headers is most useful if it reproduces the ASCII text of the headers (everything in the internal data before the blank line).

That seems to be what Thunderbird's "Show original" feature is (and the equivalent in Alpine etc.) If there's anything that is malformed or would not parse, it should reproduce that too. Not even parsing 'keys' and 'values'. Newlines and spaces are just part of this piece of text.

You've correctly pre-empted the difficulty of displaying text which has 80 character width on smaller screens. My suggestion would be a fixed width font at 80 columns width (which I assume is still standard for the headers) and pinch the screen to zoom in or out (no word wrap)

repository.name: thunderbird-android

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to improve the display of headers in the 'Show headers' feature, specifically to make them more readable and authentic for debugging purposes.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to display the headers in a readable format, specifically to reproduce the ASCII text of the headers, including newlines and spaces, for debugging purposes.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author suggests adding padding between each header item or using indent for the header's value, but the main issue is not about readability but about reproducing the ASCII text of the headers.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about displaying headers in a readable format, not just aesthetics like indentation or line spacing. The main goal is to reproduce the ASCII text of the headers, including newlines and spaces, for debugging purposes.

issueDTO.title: [Chainspecs] When invalid chainspec provided using --Init.ChainSpecPath unable to close CMD using CTRL+C
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
During testing of Embedded ChainSpecs I've noticed, that when providing invalid chainspec (empty, json invalid etc) Runner or Launcher will throw proper exception but user is unable just to close app using CTRL + C. Need to close entire cmd and type command again.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to chainspec location
2. Create new json file with just empty json chars {}
3. Open cmd on nethermind directory
4. Start Nethermind.Runner.exe with flag --Init.ChainSpecPath "path/to/new/json/spec"

**Expected behavior**
After exception thrown about empty chainspec, when user hits CTRL+C app should stop and user should be able to reuse a command after json fixes

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Windows 11, Nethermind from master branch

issueDTO.title: The EULA is Badly Formatted
issueDTO.description:
**To Reproduce**
1. Create a new wallet

issueDTO.title: Contact Form Submission - Mistake (Solution to Focus problem: GCDEX - GCD Extreme from SPOJ, Module: Divisibility, Section: Gold)
issueDTO.description:
Someone submitted the contact form!

**URL**: https://usaco.guide/dashboard/
**Module**: Solution to Focus problem: GCDEX - GCD Extreme from SPOJ, Module: Divisibility, Section: Gold
**Topic**: Mistake
**Message**: 
The solution for the focus problem GCD Extreme has a wrong time complexity, which is too slow to pass. Unless I am mistaken, the time complexity given is O(N) per query which is too slow to pass the SPOJ judge. I have verified this by submitting the given solution to SPOJ, and it indeed gives a time limit exceeded ruling. There is a much simpler solution of time complexity of O(N logN) of preprocessing + O(1) per query.

Unless I am mistaken, the time complexity given is O(N) per query which is too slow to pass the SPOJ judge. I have verified this by submitting the given solution to SPOJ, and it indeed gives a time limit exceeded ruling. There is a much simpler solution of time complexity of O(N logN) of preprocessing + O(1) per query.

issueDTO.title: Dropdowns missing on touchscreen tablet
issueDTO.description:
None of the dropdowns show up on touchscreen. This is a problem because it prevents me from accessing a lot of pages.

On properly working websites, the dropdowns appear either when I just tap on the menu, or at least when I tap on the menu and drag outside it.

The workaround is that they do show up when I plug in a mouse or touchpad, or when I enable device mode in devtools.

I am using `Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/83.0.4103.116 Safari/537.36` on a Surface Pro 7.
comments: I think this issue does not exist. @danielzgtg can you provide more details?

@ShubhamOulkar Now the dropdowns show, but they immediately disappear. This is because touchscreens fire both the hover and click events at the same time.

A solution might be to set `href="#"` for `a.active`.

Thank you, @danielzgtg, for reporting. Yes, this issue exists on some devices like laptops with touchscreens or tablets more than 1110px wide screens. 

Right now, I verified that only mouse events are got applied on these links for large screens more than 1110px. And click event applied on only small screens less than 1110px. So that your viewport is 1110px wide or more. https://github.com/expressjs/expressjs.com/blob/gh-pages/js/menu.js#L22

Can you provide viewport screenshots and device model name?
Device: Surface Pro 7 Screen: 2736x1824 (200% HiDPI)
Do you want to help us to fix this touch event issue? You can do in [menu.js](https://github.com/expressjs/expressjs.com/blob/gh-pages/js/menu.js).

repository.description: The Express.js Website
repository.name: expressjs.com

summary.main: Dropdowns are missing on touchscreen tablet devices, preventing access to certain pages, and only appear when a mouse or touchpad is used or device mode is enabled in devtools.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is specific to touchscreen devices and large screens more than 1110px wide.
summary.attemptedFixes: A solution might be to set `href='#'` for `a.active`. The issue is specific to large screens more than 1110px wide, where only mouse events are applied, and click events are applied on small screens less than 1110px.
summary.otherNotes: The issue exists on some devices like laptops with touchscreens or tablets with screens more than 1110px wide. The problem is that touchscreens fire both the hover and click events at the same time, causing dropdowns to disappear immediately.

issueDTO.title: 🐛 Bug Report: SMTP username and password aren't validated when updating SMTP settings
issueDTO.description:
### 👟 Reproduction steps

1. Update a project's SMTP settings
2. Use a valid host, port, and secure protocol, but an incorrect username and password
3. Click Update

### 👍 Expected behavior

The update should fail because the username and password are incorrect.

### 👎 Actual Behavior

The SMTP settings are updated successfully.

We use `$mail->SmtpConnecti()` test the connection:

https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/8e021158286cd04b64b391afe86975e23368a52c/app/controllers/api/projects.php#L1684-L1695

However, because `SMTPAuth` isn't set to true, the username and password are not checked.

We need to set `SMTPAuth` like we do in the worker:

https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/8e021158286cd04b64b391afe86975e23368a52c/src/Appwrite/Platform/Workers/Mails.php#L166

### 🎲 Appwrite version

Appwrite Cloud

### 💻 Operating system

Linux

### 🧱 Your Environment

_No response_

### 👀 Have you spent some time to check if this issue has been raised before?

- [x] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### 🏢 Have you read the Code of Conduct?

- [x] I have read the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/appwrite/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

issueDTO.title: 🐞YouTube Playlists
issueDTO.description: ### Concise Description YouTube Playlist thumbnails have gone all weird. ### Browser/s Firefox ### Other Browser: 140.0.4 ### 'Steps to reproduce' - Which of our features is required for the bug to happen? I opened a playlist and saw this. I disabled the extension and without needing to refresh the page, the thumbnails went back to normal. ### Since when? 11th July Evening, I first saw this. ### Does the bug still happen when you log out of YouTube? None ### ..No? Then please paste your yt.config_.EXPERIMENT_FLAGS. Twice (With the error & Without) _No response_ ### Are any errors or related log-messages shown in the Browser-Console? (F12) _No response_ ### Tested as the only active extension? (incognito mode or another browser users): None ### Expected preferred behavior: Non-weirdness ### ImprovedTube Version 4.1320 ### Your Settings (From the Extension's `???`-Hamburger menu > Settings > Backup & reset > Export settings) I have played around turning off settings I have changed and nothing has worked. ### Your YouTube-Document _No response_ ### OS / Device: Standard Desktop running Linux Mint
comments: Hey, new to open source and would love to help investigate this issue. I'll try to reproduce bug on my setup and see what part of extension causes thumbnail glitch.

@adipatil-13  Did you manage to find out anything? It is still happening but only on Linux. Windows 11 24H2 seems to not have the issue for me.

Are you using Mint 22.1 to research? I have probably used the zoom function (ctrl+up) to make the YouTube pages a little larger. On Windows here it is on 120%. I can check Mint later.
I'm also experiencing the same issue on Windows 11 24H2. Only happens in Firefox 140.0.4. Chrome version seems to be working fine.

> I'm also experiencing the same issue on Windows 11 24H2. Only happens in Firefox 140.0.4. Chrome version seems to be working fine.


Huh. Mine is fine. Same 24H2 and 140.0.4. I wonder why it's done that to yours on Windows.
Also having this issue on Brave Brower, Chrome seems ok but who wants to use that

Same here, this is happening to me too. It's not just playlist, in the Home tab of a channel, the For You, Videos, etc rows also have this cropped zoomed in view as well. 

ImprovedTube Version 4.1320

Zen browser (Firefox fork) 1.14.5b (Firefox 140.0.4) (64-bit)

Windows 10 22H2

[improvedtube.json](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21333626/improvedtube.json)

I've noticed the Home page of a channel having the problem, too but only on my Linux. Windows for me is totally fine on Firefox.

This is weird. Is there anything Zen Browser does to the Firefox options that I have changed manually that could effect it?

I manually change 'browser.enable_automatic_image_resizing' and 'browser.enable_click_image_resizing' in about:config within Firefox every time I have installed it. It is the only things I change in about:config. Maybe I haven't done this on my Linux yet; I have just started using it.

Does Zen Browser have options for theses toggles within the settings? Or does it come with these already modified?

Zen has those in about:config. Both of them are true on Zen. I don't tweak any settings directly in about:config though, so I assume that's the default on Zen. I also still have a Firefox install and both of them are true as well. 

Edit: I just tried a fresh add-on install on Firefox. Without changing anything, the videos are not stretched. I changed "Thumbnails per Row" (General > Thumbnails) to 6, and videos are still not stretched. But importing the same settings from Zen to Firefox produced the bugs. Resetting the settings, the bug isn't produced.

Alright. So it must be a setting in our 'Improve YouTube!' addons. Something we changed a while back and is now causing the problem.

I had an old settings backup from 12th October 2024 which I ported over to the Linux installed Firefox. I think it was before the issues with thumbnails. I have exported the Windows settings and had a look at the differences between them.

Here is a list of the differences. The problem must surely be here:

### **These below are new in the .json file. Changes I have made in the Windows version since the last backup, which are not in the Linux version**

"header_hide_logo":false,
"header_position":"normal",
"hide_clip_button":"hidden",
"hide_save_button":"normal",
"player_autoplay_button":false,
"player_cinema_mode_button":false,
"player_forced_volume":false,
"player_loudness_normalization":true,
"player_popup_button":false,
"player_repeat_button":false,
"player_volume":9,
"remove_member_only":true,
"title_version":true,

### **These below are the differences in settings that exist in both .json files**

"hide_share_button":"icons_only", changed to "hide_share_button":"hidden",
"lastDarkTheme":"night", changed to "lastDarkTheme":"sunset",
"lastLightTheme":"custom", changed to "lastLightTheme":"desert",
"player_color":"amber", changed to "player_color":"default",
"theme":"night", changed to "theme":"sunset",

This is a good place to start I think.

I also reloaded the old settings to the windows version and all seems to be fine with those settings, too. Which I was hoping would not be the case. Some interaction between settings and browser and OS makes it more complicated to diagnose.

Ok so I fixed the Linux YouTube Playlists last night.

- First, I backed up my settings from Windows Improve YouTube
- Went to my broken Linux version
- Opened Improve YouTube settings and clicked _backup&reset_ > _reset all settings_ 
- Opened a new tab and went to a playlist; it was fixed
- Then I imported the settings I backed up earlier
- Opened a new tab and checked the playlist and it still worked fine

It still worked today after booting up so looks like this fixed it for me.

If you backup your settings, reset them, then re-import them, checking playlists between each step; it may fix it for you, too.

If not, try switching to the settings in the last post above, that have changed between both .json files and repeat the steps.

Hopefully someone can piece together why first resetting and then re-importing my newer .json file fixed this weirdness.
If just saving, resetting, re-importing fixes others' playlists, we can rule out the change in settings between backups at least.

issueDTO.title: Update contributing documentation and templates in all repos to reflect the new standardized workflow
issueDTO.description:
This issue tracks the updates required to documentation and contributing guidelines across all repositories in the Flatcar organization, following the standardization of Pull Request workflows and branch protection rules proposed in #1714.

**Tasks:**
- Audit each repository for its current CONTRIBUTING.md, PR templates, branch protection documentation, and related workflow docs.
- Update documentation to reflect the unified workflow and branch protection rules:
  - Default branch set to `main` (or `master`), recommending `main`.
  - Only squash merging allowed; settings documented.
  - Maintainer bypass permissions and rationale.
  - All relevant PR, merge, and protection requirements described clearly for contributors.
- Ensure that each repository???s documentation is clear, accessible, and consistent with the new guidelines.
- Link back to #1714 for context and rationale.

**Acceptance criteria:**
- Every repository has up-to-date contributing documentation and templates matching the standardized workflow.
- All workflow/protection changes are cross-referenced with #1714.
- Any exceptions or repo-specific settings are documented in-place.

issueDTO.title: Add `@DisplayName` to Test Methods in Practice Exercises
issueDTO.description:
## 📝 Issue Description

This issue aims to add `@DisplayName()` annotations for **every test method** in the test files of all **practice exercises** in the Java track.

### 🔧 What You Need to Do

1. **Skip unsynced exercises:**  
   Before starting, make sure the exercise is **not** listed among the ones with unsynced tests in [issue #2959](https://github.com/exercism/java/issues/2959).

2. **Locate the test file:**
   - Go to the exercise folder inside `exercises/practice/<exercise-name>/src/test`.
   - Open the Java test file (typically named `<ExerciseName>Test.java`).

3. **Find the canonical source:**
   - Navigate to the [problem-specifications](https://github.com/exercism/problem-specifications) repo.
   - Open the corresponding exercise folder and locate `canonical-data.json`.

4. **Match and annotate tests:**
   - The test cases in the `.json` file are listed in a specific order.
   - Match the tests in the Java file with the ones in `canonical-data.json`.
   - For each test, copy the `"description"` and use it as a `@DisplayName("")` annotation above the corresponding method in the Java test file.

## ?????? Important Guidelines

- **Max 15 exercises per PR:**  
  To avoid large PRs, limit the number of exercises being updated in each PR to a maximum of 15 exercises (less is ok too). 
  
- **Do not close this issue via PRs:**  
  Avoid referencing this issue in your PR with terms like `Fixes #XXX` or `Resolves #XXX`, since this would automatically close the issue. 

- **Avoid reimplemented exercises:**  
  Make sure you are not copying descriptions from tests that have been reimplemented.

- **Need help?**  
  If you have any questions, feel free to ask in the comments!

issueDTO.title: Simplify "Bring You Own Backend" deployments
issueDTO.description:
# Feature Request

It is already possible to use any `otlphttp` exporter following the [documentation](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/demo/kubernetes-deployment/#bring-your-own-backend) for Bring Your Own Backend for Kubernetes.

While this approach works, it would be great to simplify the process of deploying the OpenTelemetry demo with a custom backend using an OTLP HTTP exporter. Additionally, deploying with Docker Compose currently requires either adding a new custom collector configuration or modifying the existing one.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**

Being able to use any `otlphttp` exporter, with minimal configuration required.

For Kubernetes deployments, it would be great to add a new configuration option in the Helm charts that allows users to easily configure the OTLP HTTP endpoint. For example:

``helm install otel-demo charts/opentelemetry-demo --set otlp-backend=true --set opentelemetry-collector.config.exporters.otlpbackend.endpoint="my-endpoint"``

For Docker Compose deployments, it would be helpful to allow overriding OTLP endpoints and headers through environment variables. Additionally, it would be useful to enable users to select which exporters to use. One potential solution could be utilizing [Docker Compose Profiles](https://docs.docker.com/compose/how-tos/profiles/), enabling users to specify the desired profile with a command like:

``PROFILE=byob make start``
comments:
Ohhhhh, TIL! 🤓 

Profiles look great!
We could drop the `minimal` docker compose override and just configure the profiles.

I liked that!

I'm struggling a little bit to understand how this would simplify things. An OTLP exporter is typically more than just an endpoint. OTLP headers are often required (especially for any SaaS vendor). Right now, we have 3 different pipelines configured for each telemetry type (traces, logs, metrics). Should this work for all 3? What if it should just be limited to 1 or 2 pipelines, how would those be specified as well?

There is certainly a level of complexity involved in needing to specify all the existing exporters because it's an array list, and YAML merges on arrays are destructive. At that same time, I'm also uncertain that this can be configured with a couple of command-line options and make things simpler.

Just to raise a discussion here.

I've tried setting up the docker compose profiles and they looked great at first sight!
We would drop 4 files in favour of 1.

But when I took a closer look to the `minimal` deployment it actually has one less env var: `KAFKA_ADDR` is not expected on the `checkout` service.
I've googled a bit but it doesn't seem to be possible to have different env vars for different profiles.

We would need to have an `.override` file, which would still be better, but not sure if that's what we expected.

Any opinions?

> But when I took a closer look to the minimal deployment it actually has one less env var: KAFKA_ADDR is not expected on the checkout service.

Could it be an option having multiple `.env` files? One for each profile and use [compose_env_files](https://docs.docker.com/compose/how-tos/environment-variables/envvars/#compose_env_files) in the Makefile.

repository.name: opentelemetry-demo

summary.main: Simplify the process of deploying the OpenTelemetry demo with a custom backend using an OTLP HTTP exporter, add a new configuration option in the Helm charts, allow overriding OTLP endpoints and headers through environment variables
summary.validationOrRequirement: Minimal configuration required, new configuration option in the Helm charts that allows users to easily configure the OTLP HTTP endpoint, override OTLP endpoints and headers through environment variables, select which exporters to use
summary.attemptedFixes: One potential solution could be utilizing Docker Compose Profiles, enabling users to specify the desired profile with a command like: PROFILE=byob make start. Another option would be to use docker compose overrides, but Profiles seems more suitable for this use case.
summary.otherNotes: It is already possible to use any otlphttp exporter following the documentation for Bring Your Own Backend for Kubernetes. For Docker Compose deployments, it would be helpful to allow overriding OTLP endpoints and headers through environment variables.

issueDTO.title: FEATURE REQUEST: Implement FAQ Handler with Web Search for Organizational Queries
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem?

- [x] Yes, it is related to a problem

### Describe the feature you'd like

## 🌟 Feature Description

This feature re-envisions the **`FAQ Handler`** as a specialized tool that leverages web search to answer general, high-level questions about the organization. It is designed to be the go-to tool for users seeking to understand the organization's mission, projects, and operational model.

It will be triggered when users ask questions like:

  * *"What is this organization all about?"*
  * *"How does this organization work?"*
  * *"What projects do you have?"*
  * *"What are the main goals of Devr.AI?"*

## 🔍 Problem Statement

Newcomers and potential contributors often have foundational questions about the organization itself before they dive into specific projects. Answering these questions manually is repetitive and inefficient. While a static knowledge base could work, it risks becoming outdated. A dynamic approach is needed to provide accurate, current information based on the organization's official public presence.

## 🎯 Expected Outcome

The `FAQ Handler` will act as an automated public-facing representative, providing instant and accurate information about the organization. The expected outcome is a system that can:

  * **Receive a general query** about the organization.
  * **Dynamically search the web**, focusing on the organization's official website, blog, and public repositories.
  * **Synthesize the search results** into a concise, easy-to-understand answer.
  * **Provide source links** to allow users to explore the topic further.

## 📷 Screenshots and Design Ideas

The workflow will be managed by the `FAQ Handler` tool, which will essentially be a specialized and intelligent implementation of a web search node.

1.  **Trigger**: A user asks a general question.
      * *User*: "What kind of projects does this organization work on?"
2.  **Input**: The user's query is passed to the `FAQ Handler`.
    ```json
    {
      "query": "What projects does this organization have?"
    }
    ```
3.  **Action - Intelligent Web Search**:
      * The tool formulates targeted search queries. For the example above, it would generate queries like:
          * `"Devr.AI open source projects"`
          * `"Devr.AI GitHub repositories"`
          * `"About Devr.AI projects"`
      * It executes these queries using the **Web Search Tool**.
4.  **Synthesis**:
      * The tool receives the top search results (snippets and URLs).
      * It feeds this context to the LLM (Gemini) with a prompt like: *"Based on the following search results, answer the user's question: 'What projects does this organization have?'"*
5.  **Output**: The tool returns a structured response containing the synthesized answer and the sources used.
    ```json
    {
      "status": "success",
      "answer": "Devr.AI primarily focuses on creating tools for developer relations (DevRel), including AI-powered assistants for community engagement, issue triage, and onboarding. You can explore our main projects on our official website and GitHub page.",
      "sources": [
        { "title": "Devr.AI - Official Website", "url": "https://devr.ai/projects" },
        { "title": "Devr.AI on GitHub", "url": "https://github.com/AOSSIE-Org/Devr.AI" }
      ]
    }
    ```
6.  **Final Action**: The DevRel Agent formats this into a helpful message and sends it to the user.

## 📋 Additional Context

By aligning the **`FAQ Handler`** with the **Web Search** tool, we ensure a "single source of truth": the organization's own website and public materials. This approach is highly scalable and low-maintenance.

To make this tool effective, the primary task is not to build a database of FAQs, but to ensure that the organization's **website is well-structured and contains clear, findable answers** to these common questions. The success of the `FAQ Handler` is directly tied to the quality of the organization's public-facing content.

### Record

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
- [ ] I want to work on implementing this feature

**FAQ Handler Implementation:**

Here's how I plan to break this down and implement it, step by step:

_Step 1: Question Intent Detection_

- Build a simple NLP classifier (or use keyword-based matching) to determine if the user???s query is a general organizational FAQ (e.g., "What projects do you have?" or "How does Devr.AI work?").

- This helps trigger the specialized FAQ Handler only for relevant questions.

_Step 2: Dynamic Web Search Tool_

- Use a web search API like:

1. [SerpAPI](https://serpapi.com/) (Google/Bing wrapper),
2. or DuckDuckGo Search API (open/free).

- Fetch top 3???5 results focused on official sources.

 _Step 3: AI-Powered Synthesis_

- Feed the top search results (title, snippet, URL) into an LLM like OpenAI GPT or Gemini using a structured prompt.

- Example prompt:

"Based on the following search results, answer this user question in a concise and helpful way: 'What projects does Devr.AI work on?'"

_Step 4: Generate Final Response_

- Parse the LLM output to:

1. Return a clear, user-friendly answer.
2. Include a list of cited sources.

_Step 5: Integration into the Main Bot or Frontend_

- Package this as a backend endpoint or a callable tool inside your chatbot/workflow agent.

- Ensure it fails gracefully (e.g., no results or poor connectivity ??? fallback message).

**🔧 Why Me?**

```
** WARNING: No distributable artefact has been generated               **
*************************************************************************

    Briefcase has not generated a standalone iOS artefact, as iOS apps
    must be published through Xcode.

    To open Xcode for your iOS project, run:

        briefcase open iOS

    and use Xcode's app distribution workflow.

*************************************************************************
```
but it doesn't say what to do after opening Xcode.  I'm left to search for an explanation of what to do next.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I found the instructions in #860 to be helpful.  They could be expanded into a documentation page on how to test an app with a physical device with a few screen shots and arrows where things need to be clicked.  I think the desired documentation is different than [the docs page on how to publish to the App Store](https://briefcase.readthedocs.io/en/stable/how-to/publishing/iOS.html), since the goal is just to run on a device tied to the developer's Apple account.  The URL to the new page in the documentation could then be shown to the user when they run `briefcase package iOS` so they know what to do next.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

At a minimum, `briefcase package iOS` could link to #860 directly, but that seems like not a good long term solution.

### Additional context

_No response_
comments:
To clarify scope - there's two changes needed:

1. A new page in the documentation, describing how to deploy an app onto an iOS device. This documentation shared a lot of similarities with the [App Store publication docs](https://briefcase.readthedocs.io/en/stable/how-to/publishing/iOS.html), 
2. Modifying the error handling in `briefcase package iOS` to provide 2 links:
   - A link to the newly added page describing how to run the app on your personal device
   - A link to the existing App Store publication docs

Instead of a completely new page, it may be possible to adapt the iOS publication docs to support both "personal device" and "App Store" publication - the general workflow is *almost* identical, with "own device" stopping at "select device and press run", but App Store publication going through the whole archiving process.
#2293 added documentation that meets the requirement of (1).
Hello, I am going to work on this during the EuroPython sprints.

Hello, I am not sure how to properly format the link in the warning message. The best solution I have was inspired by the similar link to the documentation in https://github.com/beeware/briefcase/blob/e06571a428bf5871fcb25a7809e8230e0316ba5f/src/briefcase/platforms/android/gradle.py#L187-L210 This is how it looks in the 80 columns terminal window:

While it's unfortunate that this URL runs over 80 chars, there's not much we can do while preserving the URL as a useful link. 

I guess we *could* add a shortlink - i.e., make `https://beeware.org/b/briefcase-ios-device-deployment` (or similar) a link to the docs page - but if we did that, we'd likely want to audit all the Briefcase external links so we can manage them consistently. 

So - my suggestion would be to submit a PR with the >80 char link as is, and we can open a separate issue to audit for shortlink references to BeeWare (and other) docs.

> I guess we _could_ add a shortlink - i.e., make `https://beeware.org/b/briefcase-ios-device-deployment` (or similar) a link to the docs page

I don't think a minor increase in readability justifies that maintenance burden, especially when it would involve coordination between multiple repositories. However, we can still shorten the link by adding an anchor ID, as has already been done in the "third-party packages" section. That would allow the URL fragment to be shortened to something like `#ios-deploy`.
