The issue is also related to numeric stability, with a maximum difference of 0.001 between the two outputs.

issueDTO.title: Improve `llvm.ucmp.iN.i1` codegen (specifically the 1-bit inputs case)
issueDTO.description:
(Context: I was making a rustc PR and accidentally regressed `bool::cmp` by having it use `llvm.ucmp`, thus this bug that it would be nice if `ucmp` just was smart about it.)

`llvm.ucmp.i8.i1(a, b)` is actually the same as just `zext(a) - zext(b)`: <https://alive2.llvm.org/ce/z/oHq3bh>

But today they don't codegen the same: <https://llvm.godbolt.org/z/nxWdYhvTo>

```llvm
define noundef range(i8 -1, 2) i8 @src(i1 noundef zeroext %a, i1 noundef zeroext %b) unnamed_addr {
start:
  %0 = call i8 @llvm.ucmp.i8.i1(i1 %a, i1 %b)
  ret i8 %0
}

define noundef range(i8 -1, 2) i8 @tgt(i1 noundef zeroext %a, i1 noundef zeroext %b) unnamed_addr {
start:
  %aa = zext i1 %a to i8
  %bb = zext i1 %b to i8
  %0 = sub nsw i8 %aa, %bb
  ret i8 %0
}
```
on x64 gives
```asm
src:                                    # @src
        cmp     dil, sil
        seta    al
        sbb     al, 0
        ret
tgt:                                    # @tgt
        mov     eax, edi
        sub     al, sil
        ret
```

~~I don't know if it's better to InstSimplify the `ucmp` to `sext(b) + zext(a)` or to improve the codegen for the `i1` case, but either way,~~ it'd be nice if the intrinsic worked optimally for `i1` in addition to the wider widths.

EDIT: based on comments below, sound like it'd be better to have the codegen special-case this, rather than optimize it away in the middle-end.
comments:
The arguments of `llvm.ucmp` may be of any integer type or a vector with integer element type. The argument types must match each other, and the return type must be at least as wide as `i2`, to hold the three possible return values (-1, 0, 1).

Does these rules apply to the second approach?

I wrote this specifically about when the inputs are `i1`.  The `sub` approach is wrong for other sizes, and for things like `llvm.ucmp.i8.i8` or `llvm.ucmp.i8.i32` the current codegen is already great.

(I suppose this could also be about anything that's `range(iN 0, 2)`, but that's much less important IMHO.)
We can handle this special case in `TargetLowering::expandCMP`.

Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor has already been assigned to this issue. If you believe that no one is actually working on it despite an assignment, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. In the comments of this issue, request for it to be assigned to you, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.

@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

Author: None (scottmcm)

<details>
(Context: I was making a rustc PR and accidentally regressed `bool::cmp` by having it use `llvm.ucmp`, thus this bug that it would be nice if `ucmp` just was smart about it.)

`llvm.ucmp.i8.i1(a, b)` is actually the same as just `zext(a) - zext(b)`: <https://alive2.llvm.org/ce/z/oHq3bh>

But today they don't codegen the same: <https://llvm.godbolt.org/z/nxWdYhvTo>

```llvm
define noundef range(i8 -1, 2) i8 @<!-- -->src(i1 noundef zeroext %a, i1 noundef zeroext %b) unnamed_addr {
start:
  %0 = call i8 @<!-- -->llvm.ucmp.i8.i1(i1 %a, i1 %b)
  ret i8 %0
}

define noundef range(i8 -1, 2) i8 @<!-- -->tgt(i1 noundef zeroext %a, i1 noundef zeroext %b) unnamed_addr {
start:
  %aa = zext i1 %a to i8
  %bb = zext i1 %b to i8
  %0 = sub nsw i8 %aa, %bb
  ret i8 %0
}
```
on x64 gives
```asm
src:                                    # @<!-- -->src
        cmp     dil, sil
        seta    al
        sbb     al, 0
        ret
tgt:                                    # @<!-- -->tgt
        mov     eax, edi
        sub     al, sil
        ret
```

I don't know if it's better to InstSimplify the `ucmp` to `sext(b) + zext(a)` or to improve the codegen for the `i1` case, but either way, it'd be nice if the intrinsic worked optimally for `i1` in addition to the wider widths.

</details>
Hi @scottmcm , I would like to work on this issue, can you assign this to me ?
@dipeshs809 I have no permissions to assign people here, but your note in chat here is probably sufficient to claim it.

When I'm debugging this issue, I get the below SelectionDAG with `-view-legalize-dags` flag: which clearly indicates that `ValueType` of `AssertZext` nodes is `i1`. But when I'm debugging using launch.json, in `TargetLowering::expandCMP`, I get: ```console > expression ResVT == EVT::getIntegerVT(*DAG.getContext(), 1) (bool) $11 = false > expression ResVT == EVT::getIntegerVT(*DAG.getContext(), 32) (bool) $12 = true ``` which isn't what I expected. Is my understanding incorrect somewhere about this? My idea was to use a condition that when OpCode is UCMP and when ResVT is of type i1, then convert the UCMP to SUB node of it's ZExt nodes.

> expression ResVT == EVT::getIntegerVT(*DAG.getContext(), 1)

assertzext doesn't change the type. Use `cast<VTSDNode>(N->getOperand(1))->getVT()` instead.
Ah, I see. `cast<VTSDNode>(Node->getOperand(1)->getOperand(1))->getVT()` (which is i1) works well, thanks @dtcxzyw , this gives me a way to move forward.

repository.description: The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and toolchain technologies.
repository.name: llvm-project

summary.main: Improve the codegen for llvm.ucmp.iN.i1 intrinsic, specifically for 1-bit inputs case
summary.validationOrRequirement: The intrinsic should work optimally for i1 in addition to the wider widths. The return type must be at least as wide as i2, to hold the three possible return values (-1, 0, 1).
summary.attemptedFixes: The idea was to use a condition that when OpCode is UCMP and when ResVT is of type i1, then convert the UCMP to SUB node of it's ZExt nodes. However, it was found that assertzext doesn't change the type. A suggestion was made to use cast<VTSDNode>(N->getOperand(1))->getVT() instead.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is about improving the codegen for llvm.ucmp.iN.i1 intrinsic, specifically for 1-bit inputs. It was found that the current codegen is not optimal for this case. The issue was discovered when a rustc PR accidentally regressed bool::cmp by using llvm.ucmp. The intrinsic should be smart about the 1-bit inputs case.

issueDTO.title: Docs: Interactivity API - Rename "API Reference" to "Directives and Store API Reference"
issueDTO.description:
After moving Interactivity API docs to [Block Editor Handbook > Reference Guides > Interactivity API Reference](https://developer.wordpress.org/block-editor/reference-guides/interactivity-api/), the structure of this sections is as follows:

- [Interactivity API Reference](https://developer.wordpress.org/block-editor/reference-guides/interactivity-api/)
  - [Quick start guide](https://developer.wordpress.org/block-editor/reference-guides/interactivity-api/iapi-quick-start-guide/)
  - [API Reference](https://developer.wordpress.org/block-editor/reference-guides/interactivity-api/api-reference/)

As the word "Reference" will be kept for now (see https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/issues/60782) for any subpage below [Reference Guides](https://developer.wordpress.org/block-editor/reference-guides/), with the current structure, it may be a bit confusing having "Interactivity API Reference" and "API Reference" different pages on the same section. 

Also, as per the current issue with docs generation explained at https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/issues/61206 having an `api-reference.md` file may cause conflict in the future with any other `api-reference.md` file under any other section.

To solve this situation, I suggest the following actions:
- Change the title of "API Reference" to "Directives and Store API Reference"
- Change the filename to `directives-store-api-reference.md`

This change would require a redirection.

Another option could be to simply remove the "Reference" word from "Interactivity API Reference", but this would go against the rule followed by the rest of subsections under [Reference Guides](https://developer.wordpress.org/block-editor/reference-guides/)

cc: @ndiego @cbravobernal @sirreal @luisherranz

issueDTO.title: Add white noise parameter to audio settings to keep audio alive
issueDTO.description:
<!-- Please read the text in this edit field before filling it in.
Please thoroughly read NVDA's wiki article on how to fill in this template, including how to provide the required files.
Issues may be closed if the required information is not present.
https://github.com/nvaccess/nvda/blob/master/projectDocs/issues/githubIssueTemplateExplanationAndExamples.md
Please also note that the NVDA project has a Citizen and Contributor Code of Conduct which can be found at https://github.com/nvaccess/nvda/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md. NV Access expects that all contributors and other community members read and abide by the rules set out in this document while participating or contributing to this project. This includes creating or commenting on issues and pull requests.

Each of the questions and sections below start with multiple hash symbols (#). Place your answers and information on the blank line below each question.
-->

### Steps to reproduce:
1/ Set keepalive in audio settings to any number, i.e. 30.
2. Cause NVDA to speak then wait for the keepalive timeout.
### Actual behavior:
<!--
Use "Speak command keys" (NVDA+4) and speech viewer to copy and paste here.
Use braille viewer to copy and paste here.
You may additionally include an explanation.
-->
On some headphones, specifically the Sony XM6, and the Turtle Beach Stealth 700 gen 3, the keepalive will only work for approximately 6 seconds.After this time, the headphones will stop emitting sound completely and any new speech will be cut off.
### Expected behavior:
<!--
Use "Speak command keys" (NVDA+4) and speech viewer to copy and paste here.
Use braille viewer to copy and paste here.
You may additionally include an explanation.
-->
Audio will be kept alive as requested by the keepalive setting.
This can be fixed by using the debug parameter `config.conf["audio"]["whiteNoiseVolume"] = 1`.
This setting should be exposed in the audio settings and documented in the user guide
### NVDA logs, crash dumps and other attachments:

### System configuration
#### NVDA installed/portable/running from source:
Installed.
#### NVDA version:
Version: 2025.1.2 (2025.1.2.36913)
#### Windows version:
Windows 11 Home Version 2024 H2
#### Name and version of other software in use when reproducing the issue:
None. Happens with all software.
#### Other information about your system:
This issue does not happen on JAWS whether the setting to keep bluetooth alive is enabled or not. The headphones don't seem to go into standby mode at all when using the Stealth 700s.
### Other questions
#### Does the issue still occur after restarting your computer?
Yes
#### Have you tried any other versions of NVDA? If so, please report their behaviors.
No
#### If NVDA add-ons are disabled, is your problem still occurring?
Yes
#### Does the issue still occur after you run the COM Registration Fixing Tool in NVDA's tools menu?
Yes

Hi @Jarred-F,

It's possible this is an issue with your audio driver or device, suppressing the empty sound we send. 

Could you please add the following to the next line of the [audio] line of your nvda.ini configuration file. You can find the `nvda.ini` file in `%AppData%/nvda`.
`	whiteNoiseVolume = 10`.

This will play a small amount of white noise to keep the device awake.

Let us know if this helps the problem.

See also #18155 #18166
@seanbudd, I have forward your tip to a brazilian user with the same problem and it indeed solve the problem!
But the volume in 10 was too loud. Set to 1 keeps working.
Can it be included in the Audio or Advanced sections of NVDA settings?
Shawn,

 

Maybe I???m just messing something up, but I???ve added the line and tried different volume levels, and I don???t seem to get any white noise and the issue persists. The line is automatically deleted each time I restart NVDA and doesn???t seem to take effect just by changing and saving. Am I missing a step here?

Joseph,

 

I???ve attached a copy of the debug log to the bottom of this comment, as well as attaching build information for this system. This is my ARM system running on stable channel. I can include the info from my desktop running in the insider channel if needed as well.

 
*log removed due to issue being resolved*
 

 

@Jarred-F try pressing `NVDA+control+r` after saving your `nvda.ini`.

Alternatively, open the NVDA Python Console (`NVDA+control+z`) and enter the following line exactly, then press enter:
```py
config.conf["audio"]["whiteNoiseVolume"] = 10
```

Thanks @SaschaCowley , 

I didn???t even think to save the config like that. It seems to work and solve the issue.

As requested by @ruifontes , Would it be possible to add this as a toggle or option  with volume control in NVDA;s Audio settings menu?
I agree that yes, the option should be made available in NVDA's audio settings
`config.conf["audio"]["whiteNoiseVolume"] = 1` seems to have proved that this value is enough.

Couldn't we just make this value default in the config spec? Or are some people able to hear this sound in some case?

If we add a new parameter, it seems to me that we end up with only very few use cases but still 2 parameters to control them:
* Time to keep audio device awake after speech (already existing)
* "Use background white noise" (bool) or "Use background white noise during silence" (bool) or "White noise level during silence" (int)
@CyrilleB79 - for some users that may not be enough. we've found example of audio drivers needing a higher value and still suppressing a small amount of white noise
You can add me as one of those reports. I tried the white noise at 1 to see if it would work, but, for whatever reason, I had to go to at least 2 to get it to work reliably.

In this case, unless it becomes hearable, I'd recommend to set the default value to the minimum value known to be compatible with all types of headsets (or other devices), e.g. 2.

I am quite concerned though to have a numeric parameter in audio settings. "White noise" is not a concept that is known by many people and I wonder how we can translate this to something more user-friendly.

issueDTO.title: RandomForest{Classifier,Regressor} split criterion documentation
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the issue linked to the documentation

There's no where in the documentation that explains what method is used to identify which values to consider as candidate splits. For example, for regression, an exhaustive method would be to sort each feature and then use the halfway point between each feature value. In this case there would be O(N*F) candidate splits where N=# data and F= # features. Another way would be to randomly choose K values between the min and max of each feature.

Does anyone know what method is used? Could someone point me to where in the code this occurs?

### Suggest a potential alternative/fix

_No response_
comments: I'm working on this
@howarth just to be clear , you were unable to find the methods for evaluating candidate splits , correct?
/take
@howarth got it. Working on it

@howarth 
**Current Approach:**
Scikit-learn's decision tree implementation uses the "best split" strategy as the default approach to identify candidate splits. This means that for each feature, all unique values present in the training data are considered as potential splitting points. The criterion (e.g., Gini impurity or entropy) is computed for each unique value, and the value that maximizes the reduction in impurity is selected as the splitting point for that feature.

**Alternative/Fix:**
If you are interested in an alternative approach for selecting candidate splits, you could consider using the "random split" strategy. In this approach, you randomly choose a subset of candidate values from the feature's range and evaluate the criterion for each of those values. This can significantly reduce the computational complexity, especially for features with a large number of unique values.

**Code Location:**
If you want to delve into the code to understand how candidate splits are identified, you can look into the _splitter.pyx file in scikit-learn's source code. This file contains the core logic for finding the best split in decision trees. Specifically, you can explore the `BestSplitter` class, where the process of finding the best split point is implemented. You can find this here:
https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/blob/main/sklearn/tree/_splitter.pyx
@AyushChauhan-ui thank you!

@howarth , @AyushChauhan-ui , in the scikit-learn documentation , there is no detailed documentation for gini, variance reduction (which is used for regression trees) , entropy, information gain . Also there is one more splitting method we could add called chi-square splitting method.

Also the complexity that is mentioned is for binary trees and nothing specific about what is the computational complexity for particular decision tree algorithms like CART , ID3. That could be added too.

> @howarth , @AyushChauhan-ui , in the scikit-learn documentation , there is no detailed documentation for gini, variance reduction (which is used for regression trees) , entropy, information gain . 

https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/tree.html#mathematical-formulation

> [...] for regression, an exhaustive method would be to sort each feature and then use the halfway point between each feature value. In this case there would be O(N*F) candidate splits where N=# data and F= # features. Another way would be to randomly choose K values between the min and max of each feature.

It's the former. See e.g. https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/blob/a05eb6bbe30bc40904274c87afb4ac93bcd60168/sklearn/tree/_splitter.pyx#L472

I don't think it's essential to spell this out in the User Guide, but I also don't think it would hurt. There have been some alternatives used, like left or right endpoints instead of midpoints, see e.g. https://datascience.stackexchange.com/q/32638/55122

Also, uniform selection in the feature range _is_ used, e.g. in IsolationForests.

> Also the complexity that is mentioned is for binary trees and nothing specific about what is the computational complexity for particular decision tree algorithms like CART , ID3. That could be added too.

Scikit-learn implements CART. This is indeed a decision tree and the complexity for nodes, and tree is specified there: https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/tree.html#complexity.

While complexity is interesting, it will not give you the info about the splitter. Also the original question was something about random forest while here we are speaking decision tree.

So I see several documentation improvement:

- [x] Improve the docstring of the `RandomForestClassifier` and `RandomForestRegressor` to make it obvious that the decision tree used under the hood are using `splitter="best"`. I see that the `RandomForestRegressor` docstring is wrong because it refers to decision tree classifiers instead of regressors (it should be corrected as well).
- [ ] Improve the user guide (https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/ensemble.html#random-forests) for the Random Forest to also mention that we use the best splitter for those.
- [ ] Improve the user guide (https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/tree.html#tree) of the decision tree such that we explain the best/random search. As far I can say, the requested information by @howarth could have been made explicit in the first paragraph of the "Mathematical formulation". This section is kind of written having the best splitter in mind, so we would need to either create a section or rework the narrative. I would see a section for finding the best split (the current narrative is nice) and add that split candidate are assessed exhaustively by a brute-force approach. Then, in the next section, I would explain the random approach simply by stating that we pick up a single split candidate randomly by feature.

An important point while modifying the documentation is to keep it as simple as possible and as succinct as possible as well.
/take

Hi all,

Thanks for the detailed discussion. I???ve reviewed the thread and code references. I???d be happy to help improve the documentation for RandomForestClassifier and RandomForestRegressor, especially around clarifying the use of the splitter="best" strategy and how candidate splits are selected.

I???ll start by drafting additions for:

The RandomForest* class docstrings to mention the best splitter.

A short explanation in the [Random Forests user guide](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/ensemble.html#random-forests) referencing that candidate splits are selected exhaustively per feature, using midpoint thresholds.

Possibly extending the [Decision Trees guide](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/tree.html#tree) with a brief ???Finding the Best Split??? subsection for clarity.

Let me know if that direction sounds good. Happy to submit a PR for review.

??? nithish-74
/take

issueDTO.title: bug: Unable to fund accounts with ETH in forked e2e tests
issueDTO.description:
### Problem
When a forked e2e test is created without specifying the fork block number, as follows
https://github.com/cowprotocol/services/blob/42943137381008b050303f871093f234f1a594b5/crates/e2e/tests/e2e/quote_verification.rs#L81-L90
, there is no way to fund an account with ETH:
https://github.com/cowprotocol/services/blob/42943137381008b050303f871093f234f1a594b5/crates/e2e/tests/e2e/quote_verification.rs#L552-L568

### Impact
While the issue is not critical, it can block a proper testing of some features, such as UniV3 support in the baseline solver, which requires funding.

### To reproduce
Run the following test from the `univ3-support-in-baseline-zero-balance` branch:
```
cargo test -p e2e forked_node_mainnet_usdt_quote_univ3 -- --ignored --nocapture
```

### Expected behaviour
Both solver and trader accounts must be funded with ETH.
comments:
Last time I ran into this it seemed like a bug in anvil. Best to confirm this and open an issue in their repo.
But to make this issue less surprising I already added assertions and a comment to catch this ASAP in a test.

issueDTO.title: bug: Duplicate "created" event in order_events table
issueDTO.description: ### Problem Multiple created events are being written for the same order_uid + timestamp pair in the order_events table. ### Impact The duplicates lead to data inconsistency and can result in double-counting, double-billing, and mis-reporting. They also prevent creating a unique index which can be useful for logical replication. ### To reproduce 1. Connect to the `arbitrum` Postgres instance. 2. Run. ``` SELECT encode(order_uid, 'hex') AS order_uid_hex, "timestamp", label FROM ( SELECT *, COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY order_uid, "timestamp", label) AS dup_cnt FROM order_events WHERE label = 'created' -- filter early ) t WHERE dup_cnt > 1 -- keep only real duplicates LIMIT 10; ``` 3. Observe that dup_cnt > 1 for the returned rows. ### Expected behaviour For any given (order_uid, timestamp, label='created') combination, there should be exactly one row in order_events. ### Screenshots/logs
comments:
I suspect the reason is that we store the `order_events` row before the order insert fails due to a duplicate order.
It would make sense to do all of this in a single transaction.

issueDTO.title: Support for `{locale}/{namespace}.json` resource loading (ICU format compatible)
issueDTO.description:
**Feature Request**

Enable Intlayer to load i18n resources structured as `**/{locale}/{namespace}.json`, commonly used by libraries such as **i18next**, **next-intl**, and **vue-i18n**.

### Motivation

To facilitate smooth migrations from popular internationalization libraries, we should support reading JSON resource files that follow the `{locale}/{namespace}.json` pattern. This makes it easier for developers to adopt **Intlayer** without having to restructure their existing i18n files.

---

### Proposal

Introduce support for dynamically loading and flattening these JSON resources via a configuration helper, such as `ressourcesListener`.

**Example usage in `intlayer.config.ts`:**

```ts
import { Locales, type IntlayerConfig, ressourcesListener } from 'intlayer';
import appDirEs from "./ressources/es/app.json"

const config: IntlayerConfig = {
  internationalization: {
    locales: [Locales.ENGLISH, Locales.FRENCH, Locales.SPANISH],
    defaultLocale: Locales.ENGLISH,
  },
  content: {
    contentDir: ['.'], // watch content declaration files from the project root
    ressources: {
      app: {
        en: import('./ressources/en/app.json'),
        fr: require('./ressources/fr/app.json'),
        es: appDirEs,
      },
      ...ressourcesListener("./ressources/{locale}/{namespace}.json"),
    },
  },
};

export default config;
```

---

### Expected Behavior

The `ressourcesListener` utility should:

* Automatically traverse paths matching the pattern
* Populate the `ressources` object by extracting `locale` and `namespace`
* Output a structure like:

```ts
{
  app: {
    en: { title: "Hello" },
    fr: { title: "Bonjour" },
    es: { title: "Hola" }
  },
  ...
}
```

---

### Benefit

* Eases migration from existing i18n systems
* Promotes compatibility with widely adopted file organization practices
* Encourages contribution and adoption from larger frontend communities

---

### Implementation Notes (suggested)

* Use `glob` or similar to find matching files
* Extract `{locale}` and `{namespace}` via regex from file paths
* Implement `ressourceListerner` function into `@intlayer/core` package and reexport it into `intlayer` package
* Add configuration field at `packages/@intlayer/config/src/configFile/buildConfigurationFields.ts`
* Add a loadICURessources function called at `packages/@intlayer/chokidar/src/loadDictionaries/loadDictionaries.ts` executed after `loadContentDeclarations`
* Read json files using `packages/@intlayer/config/src/loadExternalFile.ts`

---

### AC 
* ICU ressources can be enriched using additional content declaration. Both together will be merged in a dimilar way than distant and locale content declaration are merged at the `packages/@intlayer/chokidar/src/transpiler/declaration_file_to_dictionary/intlayer_dictionary/buildIntlayerDictionary.ts` stage.

issueDTO.title: Add hook to retrieve a `t()` function for migration
issueDTO.description:
**Feature Request**

Implement a new `useXxxxx(namespace)` hook that provides a `t()` function to access translations by key, mimicking established patterns from libraries such as **i18next**, **next-intl**, and **vue-i18n**.

---

**Motivation**

Most developers coming from established i18n libraries expect to use a simple `t()` function to access translations within a specific namespace. Supporting this pattern:

* Increases developer familiarity
* Reduces friction during migration to Intlayer
* Aligns with best practices across the ecosystem

---

**Examples from other libraries**

* **next-intl**

  ```ts
  const t = useTranslations('IndexPage');
  t('title'); // ??? "Hello"
  ```

* **react-i18next / next-i18next**

  ```ts
  const { t } = useTranslation('IndexPage');
  t('title'); // ??? "Hello"
  ```

* **vue-i18n**

  ```ts
  const { t } = useI18n({ useScope: 'local', messages });
  t('title');
  ```

---

**Proposal**

Add a `getTFunction(namespace, locale)` function to the `@intlayer/core` package and re-wrap it from:
Add a `useXxxxx(namespace)` hook from:
* `react-intlayer`
* `next-intlayer`
* `vue-intlayer`
* `preact-intlayer`

Each adapter will retrieve the active `locale` (in the same way as the existing `useIntlayer` hook), then resolve the proper dictionary using the given `namespace`.

this t() function can reuse the existing `getNesting` (`packages/@intlayer/core/src/interpreter/getNesting.ts`) utility.

---

**Usage**

```ts
const t = useXxxxx('IndexPage');
t('title'); // returns translated string
```

---

**Typing Support**

The hook should provide auto-completion and type safety for dictionary keys, using the existing `getNesting` (`packages/@intlayer/core/src/interpreter/getNesting.ts`) utility:

```ts
type GetNestingType = <K extends DictionaryKeys, P>(
  dictionaryKey: K,
  path?: P extends ValidDotPathsFor<K> ? P : never,
  props?: NodeProps
) => GetNestingResult<K, P>;
```

This ensures:

* `namespace` (dictionaryKey) must be valid
* `t('...')` is type-safe and autocompleted based on valid dot-paths

---

**Server-Side Support**

* The server version should match the API shape of the client hook to support SSR compatibility. refer to useIntlayer implementation 

**Name suggestion for useXxxxx`
- useI18n
- useTranslationFunction

issueDTO.title: Add UI tab in VS Code extension to interact with Intlayer dictionaries
issueDTO.description:
**Feature Request**

Enhance the VS Code extension with a dedicated UI tab to interact with **local and distant Intlayer dictionaries**. This feature will provide an intuitive visual interface for developers to manage translation content directly within their editor.

Repository: [intlayer-vs-code-extension](https://github.com/aymericzip/intlayer-vs-code-extension)

---

**Objective**

Allow users to authenticate with their Intlayer project and:

* Retrieve (pull) distant dictionaries
* Push local changes to remote dictionaries
* View and edit dictionary content in a structured way

---

**Planned Features**

* **Authentication panel**

  * Login to Intlayer project
  * Store credentials/token securely

* **Dictionary sync**

  * Retrieve remote dictionaries and store locally
  * Push updates from local files to remote

* **Dictionary explorer tab**

  * Browse namespaces and locales
  * View content of dictionaries in a tree or table format
  * Inline editing of values
  * Change tracking (dirty state, pending pushes)

* **Publishing**

  * Manual push trigger
  * Push individual keys, files, or full dictionary sets

---

**Feature Example**

1. Offer a *Intlayer* panel
2. Log in to your Intlayer account/project
3. View the list of dictionaries
4. Make changes directly in the editor UI
5. *Push Changes* to sync with the remote

---

**Benefits**

* Simplifies collaboration on multilingual projects with distant content
* Keeps local and remote dictionaries in sync

issueDTO.title: Rethink `FeaturesSection` on Website - Design for Mobile
issueDTO.description:
The `FeaturesSection` component (located in
`apps/website/src/components/LandingPage/FeaturesSection/index.tsx`) currently renders well on desktop, but on **mobile devices**, it presents two main issues:

1. **Poor Rendering:**
   The layout does not adapt well to small screens, making the section hard to read and visually inconsistent with the rest of the landing page.

2. **High Processing Load:**
   The animations, layout structure, or component complexity seem to require too much processing for mobile devices, potentially leading to frame drops or sluggish scroll performance.


Rethink the FeaturesSection design to improve mobile rendering and reduce performance overhead on low-powered devices.

issueDTO.title: Decommission active consumers information tracking
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Description

When we worked on the dashboard sharing functionality, we added the functionality that tracked with which roles the dashboard had been shared. This information was saved on the service side for business decision needs. But now, after more than a year, we don't need this information anymore and has stopped saving it on the service side.

We also need to update the plugin to stop sending this information to the service. In particular, we need to stop using `Active_Consumers` and `Activity_Metrics` classes and remove them.

https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/aaa172cf6f0b32e7d74d95cef31b535f0798b809/includes/Core/Dashboard_Sharing/Activity_Metrics/Active_Consumers.php#L23 https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/aaa172cf6f0b32e7d74d95cef31b535f0798b809/includes/Core/Dashboard_Sharing/Activity_Metrics/Activity_Metrics.php#L23

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

* Active consumer information is no longer stored or sent with refresh token requests, and related infra is removed entirely

## Implementation Brief

* [ ] In `Google\Site_Kit\Core\Authentication\Clients\OAuth_Client`
  * Remove usage of `Active_Consumers` and `Activity_Metrics` in their class property and their usage across the class
* [ ] From `tests/phpunit/integration/Core/Authentication/Clients/OAuth2Test.php` - remove usage of `active_consumers` https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/3d0b6f339011e8e4f3e406164c8228e27cbd1697/tests/phpunit/integration/Core/Authentication/Clients/OAuth2Test.php#L43
* [ ] Remove `Google\Site_Kit\Core\Dashboard_Sharing\Activity_Metrics\Active_Consumers` class
* [ ] In `includes/Core/Dashboard_Sharing/Dashboard_Sharing.php`
  * Remove `Activity_Metrics` usage
* [ ] Remove `Google\Site_Kit\Core\Dashboard_Sharing\Activity_Metrics\Activity_Metrics` class

### Test Coverage

* Remove `Active_ConsumersTest`, `Activity_MetricsTest`, and `tests/phpunit/integration/Core/Authentication/Clients/OAuth_ClientTest.php`

## QA Brief

* Smoke test the plugin with a focus on Dashboard Sharing feature and OAuth authentication.

## Changelog entry

* Remove active consumers and activity metrics tracking functionality.

issueDTO.title: Add space in the button for clarity
issueDTO.description:
Hi, this is a [first-timers-only issue](https://publiclab.github.io/community-toolbox/#r=all). This means we've worked to make it more legible to folks who either **haven't contributed to our codebase before, or even folks who haven't contributed to open source before**. 

If that's you, we're interested in helping you take the first step and can answer questions and help you out as you do. Note that we're especially interested in contributions from people from groups underrepresented in free and open source software!

We know that the process of creating a pull request is the biggest barrier for new contributors. This issue is for you 💝

If you have contributed before, **consider leaving this one for someone new**, and looking through our general [help wanted](https://github.com/publiclab/simple-data-grapher/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22help+wanted%22) issues. Thanks!

### 🤔 What you will need to know.

Nothing. This issue is meant to welcome you to Open Source :) We are happy to walk you through the process.

### Problem


### 📋Solution

- [ ] 🙋 **Claim this issue**: Comment below. If someone else has claimed it, ask if they've opened a pull request already and if they're stuck -- maybe you can help them solve a problem or move it along!

Add space after `Create Spreadsheet` in this line below

1. If you are familiar with the terminal or would like to learn it, [here is a great tutorial](https://egghead.io/series/how-to-contribute-to-an-open-source-project-on-github) on how to send a pull request using the terminal.

2. You can also [edit files directly in your browser](https://help.github.com/articles/editing-files-in-your-repository/) and open a pull request from there. 

- [ ] 🏁 **Done** Ask in comments for a review :)


### 🤔??? Questions?

Leave a comment below!

### Is someone else already working on this?

We encourage you to link to this issue by mentioning the issue # in your pull request, so we can see if someone's already started on it. **If someone seem stuck, offer them some help!** Otherwise, [take a look at some other issues you can help with](https://publiclab.github.io/community-toolbox/#r=all). Thanks!

issueDTO.title: [RF] Allow RooUniform to set lower and upper bounds (support)
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I wanted to fit my data with a uniform distribution (I know the simple analytical answer), but it turned out that it's not possible to set bounds for it. [RooUniform](https://root.cern/doc/master/classRooUniform.html) creates a uniform distribution for the whole range of its variable (or many variables in the case of many dimensions).

On the [forum](https://root-forum.cern.ch/t/rooaddpdf-sum-of-uniform-distributions/18927/2) @lmoneta writes in 2015: "You cannot really assign weights to a RooUniformPdf." (but probably this has already changed, because I see that it is a subclass of RooAbsPdf, like RooGaussian).

### Describe the solution you'd like
Change the constructor to

    RooUniform(const char *name, const char *title, RooAbsReal &x_low, RooAbsReal &x_up)

One- and multidimensional uniform distributions should become separate (like [RooGaussian](https://root.cern/doc/master/classRooGaussian.html) and [RooMultiVarGaussian](https://root.cern/doc/master/classRooMultiVarGaussian.html) (note also a spurious line break in its docs)). Probably there is even no need for the multidimensional uniform distribution, since it's just a product of one-dimensional pdfs (if you don't model complicated support shapes).

The uniform (rectangular) distribution is just one of pdfs (see Wikipedia, [Continuous uniform distribution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuous_uniform_distribution)). It is a normal pdf, and its parameters are its lower and upper bounds. They should be set like other pdf parameters in RooFit.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I think that there are no alternatives. No reason to model this with step functions or histograms. The uniform distribution is a simple and pretty basic probability distribution.

### Additional context
I [asked about this on the forum](https://root-forum.cern.ch/t/uniform-rectangular-pdf-with-variable-range/44232), but now as I better understand RooFit and as I see no answers for RooUniform, I think this is the only solution.

P.S. There is a spurious line break in RooUniform class description.
comments:
Hi @ynikitenko, sorry for coming back to this issue so late! But I think I have now a compromise solution.

The problem is that adding new parameters to the RooUniform would mean adding new serializable class members, which might have unpleasant implications, for example of RooWorkspace size and would also need to be discussed with the HS3 serialization guys, which also have specified a uniform distribution.

> The uniform (rectangular) distribution is just one of pdfs (see Wikipedia, [Continuous uniform distribution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuous_uniform_distribution)). It is a normal pdf, and its parameters are its lower and upper bounds. They should be set like other pdf parameters in RooFit.

Well, that's your opinion and it might be the right claim. But one might also argue that the parameters are already encoded in the observable range. And if you introduce additional parameters within the full range, the pdf is not uniform within the full observable range anymore, which can be confusing given the name "RooUniform".

> I think that there are no alternatives. No reason to model this with step functions or histograms.

Why not? There is an alternative. You can wrap a step function ("RooStepFunction") with only one interval in a RooWrapper pdf, and you have a uniform pdf as you describe:
```c++
   RooRealVar x{"x", "x", 5.0, 0.0, 10.0};
   RooRealVar a{"a", "a", 3.0, 0.0, 10.0};
   RooRealVar b{"b", "b", 7.0, 0.0, 10.0};

   RooStepFunction stepFunc{"step", "", x, RooArgList{1.0}, {a, b}};
   RooWrapperPdf stepPdf{"pdf", "", stepFunc};
```
The non-boundary related parameter can be an arbitrary constant since it is normalized out.

The only problem with this approach is that right now RooFit doesn't know how to analytically normalize this pdf, but I have opened a PR to make this work:

  * https://github.com/root-project/root/pull/17593

Is this an acceptable compromise to you towards closing the issue?
Closing after merging the suggested alternative. Feel free to open a new issue or reopen this one if this doesn't work for you!

Hi @guitargeek . That is fine. I have already forgotten the logic behind that feature request (how it is connected with the rest of the RooFit ecosystem), but I'll do my best to answer your update!

> The problem is that adding new parameters to the RooUniform would mean adding new serializable class members

I think that this should not be an issue. If one wants constant interface, they don't update the code, right? My goal was how to improve the existing interface.

> But one might also argue that the parameters are already encoded in the observable range.

I believe that would make it consistent with other RooPdfs. Every RooPdf can have use that same variable. For some pdfs there are areas where the pdf can be zero, and it is fine.
Or how is it done for other pdfs? Are they defined for the whole range of the variable?

> You can wrap a step function ("RooStepFunction")

Thank you. However, that approach looks complicated. And it is different from how other pdfs are created.

So is there a simple way to create that simple pdf? Maybe you could create a pdf with a different name for that purpose, if you need a uniform pdf for the whole variable range?

Sorry, I completely forgot RooFit logic throughout that time. Please re-open the issue as you suggested, I don't have a permission for that.

I think that supporting analytical integration of RooStepFunction is a good improvement for that, but it doesn't make creating a uniform pdf really easy.

Thank you.

The issue has been discussed on the Root forum and a PR has been opened to implement the suggested alternative.

issueDTO.title: The `TMT_SSH_*` options have no effect
issueDTO.description:
Currently the ssh options provided as `TMT_SSH_*` environment variables are appended to the list if default options:

https://github.com/teemtee/tmt/blob/32ca248bd0e14ef8b9fe00f3d0235dfc3c0c2e2e/tmt/steps/provision/__init__.py#L155-L159

An example command line:

    TMT_SSH_SERVER_ALIVE_INTERVAL=3 TMT_SSH_SERVER_ALIVE_COUNT_MAX=3 tmt run -vvv

Results into this:

    > /home/psss/git/tmt/tmt/steps/provision/__init__.py(160)<module>()
    (Pdb) pp BASE_SSH_OPTIONS
    ['-oForwardX11=no',
    '-oStrictHostKeyChecking=no',
    '-oUserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null',
    '-oConnectionAttempts=5',
    '-oConnectTimeout=60',
    '-oServerAliveInterval=5',
    '-oServerAliveCountMax=60',
    '-oServerAliveCountMax=3',
    '-oServerAliveInterval=3']

It seems that `ssh` respects the first one provided so the values from the environment variables are ignored. We should drop the duplicate names from the list to make it actualy working.

There are some options though, which can be provided multiple times and should be preserved, for example:

    ssh -o "IdentityFile=~/.ssh/key_one" -o "IdentityFile=~/.ssh/key_two"
comments:
> Currently the ssh options provided as `TMT_SSH_*` environment variables are appended to the list if default options:
> 
> [tmt/tmt/steps/provision/__init__.py](https://github.com/teemtee/tmt/blob/32ca248bd0e14ef8b9fe00f3d0235dfc3c0c2e2e/tmt/steps/provision/__init__.py#L155-L159)
> 
> Lines 155 to 159 in [32ca248](/teemtee/tmt/commit/32ca248bd0e14ef8b9fe00f3d0235dfc3c0c2e2e)
> 
>  #: Base SSH options. 
>  #: This is the base set of SSH options tmt would use for all SSH 
>  #: connections. It is a combination of the default SSH options and those 
>  #: provided by environment variables. 
>  BASE_SSH_OPTIONS: tmt.utils.RawCommand = DEFAULT_SSH_OPTIONS + configure_ssh_options() 
> An example command line:
> 
> ```
> TMT_SSH_SERVER_ALIVE_INTERVAL=3 TMT_SSH_SERVER_ALIVE_COUNT_MAX=3 tmt run -vvv
> ```
> 
> Results into this:
> 
> ```
> > /home/psss/git/tmt/tmt/steps/provision/__init__.py(160)<module>()
> (Pdb) pp BASE_SSH_OPTIONS
> ['-oForwardX11=no',
> '-oStrictHostKeyChecking=no',
> '-oUserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null',
> '-oConnectionAttempts=5',
> '-oConnectTimeout=60',
> '-oServerAliveInterval=5',
> '-oServerAliveCountMax=60',
> '-oServerAliveCountMax=3',
> '-oServerAliveInterval=3']
> ```
> 
> It seems that `ssh` respects the first one provided so the values from the environment variables are ignored. We should drop the duplicate names from the list to make it actualy working.
>
> There are some options though, which can be provided multiple times and should be preserved...

Wouldn't we need to keep a list of options that need to be pruned? What if we prepend options from envvars, instead of adding them at the end of base options? That way the envvars ones would be the first ones seen by `ssh`, and those that can be repeated would still propagated.

> What if we prepend options from envvars, instead of adding them at the end of base options?

Yeah, that sounds also good. We should just ensure the expectation that `ssh` always picks the first provided option is true. Might be that a random options takes effect? Probably/hopefully not, but let's double check.

From comments (trying to understand the code) 

### Observed Behavior: SSH `ServerAliveInterval` & `ServerAliveCountMax` Overrides 

I've been looking into some behavior related to SSH connection options, specifically `ServerAliveInterval` and `ServerAliveCountMax`, when running `tmt` commands like:

Running `TMT_SSH_SERVER_ALIVE_INTERVAL=7 TMT_SSH_SERVER_ALIVE_COUNT_MAX=9 ~/.local/share/hatch/env/virtual/tmt/ovVD67rI/dev/bin/tmt  run --scratch -vvi /tmp/something -a provision -h virtual`

It seems that despite setting these environment variables, the final `ssh` command executed by `rsync` was not reflecting the desired values.

**Initial Investigation:**

The issue appears to stem from the order in which `BASE_SSH_OPTIONS` was being constructed. When `DEFAULT_SSH_OPTIONS` were added *before* `configure_ssh_options()`, the values from the defaults were taking precedence.

Here's what I observed in the `rsync` command before any changes:

```bash
11:39:38         Run command: rsync -s -p --chmod=755 -e 'ssh -oForwardX11=no -oStrictHostKeyChecking=no -oUserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -oConnectionAttempts=5 -oConnectTimeout=60 -oServerAliveInterval=5 -oServerAliveCountMax=60 -oServerAliveCountMax=9 -oServerAliveInterval=7 -oIdentitiesOnly=yes -p10025 -i /tmp/something/plan/provision/default-0/id_ecdsa -oPasswordAuthentication=no -S/tmp/something/ssh-sockets/127.0.0.1-10025-root.socket' /tmp/something/plan/discover/default-0/tests/tmt-test-wrapper-outer.sh-smoke-1-default-0-default-0 root@127.0.0.1:/tmp/something/plan/discover/default-0/tests/tmt-test-wrapper-outer.sh-smoke-1-default-0-default-0
```

Notice how `-oServerAliveInterval=5 -oServerAliveCountMax=60` (likely from `DEFAULT_SSH_OPTIONS`) appears *before* the desired `-oServerAliveCountMax=9 -oServerAliveInterval=7` (from environment variables). SSH processes options in order, so the earlier ones effectively override the later ones if they're the same type.

-----

### Proposed Solution / Fix (and its effect) 

By changing the order of concatenation for `BASE_SSH_OPTIONS` to:

`BASE_SSH_OPTIONS: tmt.utils.RawCommand = configure_ssh_options() + DEFAULT_SSH_OPTIONS`

...we ensure that the custom options (derived from environment variables via `configure_ssh_options()`) are added *first*. This makes them the effective options for the `ssh` command.

Here's the `rsync` command output **after** this change:

```bash
11:09:52         Run command: rsync -s -R -r -z --links --safe-links --protect-args --exclude /tmp/something/plan/execute/data/guest/default-0/smoke-1/output.txt --exclude /tmp/something/plan/execute/data/guest/default-0/smoke-1/output.txt -e 'ssh -oServerAliveCountMax=9 -oServerAliveInterval=7 -oForwardX11=no -oStrictHostKeyChecking=no -oUserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -oConnectionAttempts=5 -oConnectTimeout=60 -oServerAliveInterval=5 -oServerAliveCountMax=60 -oIdentitiesOnly=yes -p10025 -i /tmp/something/plan/provision/default-0/id_ecdsa -oPasswordAuthentication=no -S/tmp/something/ssh-sockets/127.0.0.1-10025-root.socket' root@127.0.0.1:/tmp/something/plan/data /
```

As you can see, `-oServerAliveCountMax=9 -oServerAliveInterval=7` now appears at the beginning of the SSH options, confirming that our custom settings are correctly applied.

This change should resolve any issues where custom `ServerAliveInterval` and `ServerAliveCountMax` values weren't being honored.

--- 

As a next step , for command line options . Let me verify as Petr said
>  We should just ensure the expectation that ssh always picks the first provided option is true.

# SSH Option Precedence: Test Results

We've observed varied precedence rules for SSH command-line options. Here's a quick rundown:

---

## First One Wins (for some value assignments)

For options that assign a specific value, like port or user, the **first one specified takes effect**:

* **Port (`-p`)**:
    `ssh user@host -p 2222 -p 22` will connect to **port 2222**.
* **User (`-l`)**:
    `ssh -l vaibhav -l root host` will attempt to log in as **vaibhav**.


## All Are Considered (for lists)

When providing multiple instances of options that take a list (like identity files), SSH tries them **in order**:

* **Identity File (`-i`)**:
    `ssh user@host -i ~/.ssh/key1 -i ~/.ssh/key2` will attempt to authenticate with `key1`, then `key2` if `key1` fails.


## Last One Wins (for conflicting flags)

For simple on/off flags, the **last one set overrides earlier ones**:

* **Verbose/Quiet (`-v`/`-q`)**:
    `ssh user@host -v -q` will run in **quiet** mode.
    `ssh user@host -q -v` will run in **verbose** mode (to the highest level indicated by `-v`s).


**Bottom line:** SSH command-line parsing isn't always "last one wins." Behavior depends on the option type.

issueDTO.title: [Docs]: Cloudfront CreateDistribution Custom Error Response ResponsePagePath/ResponseCode
issueDTO.description:
### Documentation Link

https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/cloudfront_distribution#custom-error-response-arguments

### Description

If you specify a response_page_path or response_page_code, you must specific both or neither of them.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/latest/APIReference/API_CustomErrorResponse.html#cloudfront-Type-CustomErrorResponse-ResponsePagePath

No

issueDTO.title: Add "Commiter" and "Commit Date" to Commit Meta
issueDTO.description: Git differentiates between "author" and "committer" when recording commit meta data.
comments: happy to take this own if y'all want. cheers

There's definitely value in matching Git in this regard. If you want to take this on, we'd welcome it.

That said, there's some complexities here. This won't be as simple as just adding the extra field to the metadata: we'd need to make sure that there are tools for both setting author and committer, that we render this information when relevant, and that operations that we expect to modify one but not the other (such as rebase) work as expected.

This would also likely break the ability of older clients to read commits made my newer clients: Dolt bails out when it encounters a field in storage that it doesn't recognize, as a precaution. These breaking changes can be disruptive to users, so even if this is added it would likely be disabled by default.

Thanks Nick. I kinda played around with this already and figured as much as you stated. Let me formalize what I have and put it in a draft PR so that I can ask pointed questions we can have placed discussions and then if its something of value I'm happy to proceed (or help out in other areas y'all need help if it ends up taking a backseat).

cheers

summary.attemptedFixes: andy-wm-arthur played around with the issue and figured out the complexities, but has not submitted a draft PR yet.
summary.otherNotes: Git differentiates between 'author' and 'committer' when recording commit meta data. Adding the extra field to the metadata is complex and requires tools for setting author and committer, rendering information when relevant, and handling operations that modify one but not the other. Breaking changes may occur and could be disruptive to users.

issueDTO.title: [RF] RooDataHist::printDataHistogram should be renamed and moved
issueDTO.description:
`RooDataHist::printDataHistogram` was recently added to print the bin contents of a `RooDataHist`. While very useful, this function needs several changes:
- The observable should not be passed as an argument. Rather, the histogram already knows its observables and could behave accordingly.
- The current implementation does not work for histograms with more than 1 observable
- The function should be renamed to `printContents` and moved upwards the inheritance hierarchy to instead be declared in `RooAbsData`. A version for `RooDataSet` should be implemented as well.

issueDTO.title: Bot prevention : IP limit filter
issueDTO.description:
[Version fran??aise (google translate)]()

### Problem

- Some bot are grabbing us. Ok, that's not a big problem, we are quiet open ;) 
-  but we have to provide some "bot access control" features, to prevent fronts and backs outages
- we will also need this kind of feature for the B2B API 

### Solution

- Implement a cool spring filter, that allows a MAX_REQUEST_PER_IP limit, that whitelist known bots, ...
- Will redirect to a captcha protected page (done in #315 ) to reinit the counter in case when limits are reached 

### Requisites

-  must be a generic and well documented mechanism, to be able to use it easily in new controlers / endpoints that must be bot protected. 
- must be configurable, with limits (count and time window)
- must provides a IP whitelisting mechanism , to inject authorized engines ips (bots adress will be handled in a separate service )
- must provides a IP blacklisting mechanism , to inject forbidden engines ips (bots adress will be handled in a separate service )

- should be a spring approach, or something that can easily be applied in spring context

### Tips /  work tracks

- Can have a look at the commented commons/src/main/java/org/open4goods/filter/QuotasFilter.java, a old legacy implementation of this kind of stuf
- maybe something exists, or could be a new, separate spring boot starter project ?

summary.attemptedFixes: There is a reference to an old legacy implementation in QuotasFilter.java, and it's suggested to look into it or create a new Spring Boot starter project.

issueDTO.title: Add namespace_inode to process resource id
issueDTO.description:
Motivation

While working on https://github.com/elastic/security-team/issues/3532, we've decided to handle the `namespace_inode` at a later stage.

Definition of done

Process resource id should include the `namespace_inode`.

Please follow the following checklist at the beginning of your work, please comment with a suggested high-level solution. It should include:

- [ ]  Comment describing high level implementation details
- [ ]  Include API and data models
- [ ]  Include assumptions being taken
- [ ]  Provide backward/forward compatibility when changing data model schemas and key constants
- [ ]  Mention relevant individuals with a reason (getting feedback, FYI etc)
- [ ]  Submit a PR for our [technical index](https://github.com/elastic/security-team/blob/main/docs/cloud-security-posture-team/Technical_Index.md) that includes breaking changes/ new features before closing this ticket.
comments: Clarification: According to @jeniawhite this will require changes in osquery (fetching the `namespace_inode`). See his detailed [comment](https://github.com/elastic/security-team/issues/3532#issuecomment-1115805066): > Some comments about the `namespace_inode`. Attempted to fill in the gaps on what is needed in order to add this capability. > > We are using the [osquery proc library](https://github.com/elastic/beats/tree/master/x-pack/osquerybeat/ext/osquery-extension/pkg/proc) for the process information that we are collecting. It is parsing the `stat` file under the `/proc/pid` folder in order to get the information about the process. > >I've read a bit more about `namespace_inode` at [pid_namespaces](https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/pid_namespaces.7.html) and found out about the `/proc/*pid*/ns/` folder that has information about the namespace of the PID (there are symlinks inside). > >Then I've located this [demo code](https://man7.org/tlpi/code/online/dist/namespaces/pid_namespaces.go.html) that pulls up the information and builds the namespace_inode. > >I've looked at [process entity_id issue](https://github.com/elastic/security-team/issues/2458). >After browsing the code of `elastic-dev`, I've noticed that they are building the unique PID out of PID number and timestamp here in this [source code](https://github.com/elastic/endpoint-dev/blob/main/Plugins/Events/Lib/Events.cpp#L524-L546). > >From my understanding the fetcher is reading the `hosts` `/proc` folder in order to get the process information, which means that the `namespace_inode` will be the same the for the processes: >

repository.description: Analyzing Cloud Security Posture
repository.name: cloudbeat

summary.main: Add namespace_inode to process resource id
summary.validationOrRequirement: Process resource id should include the `namespace_inode`.
summary.attemptedFixes: Some comments about the `namespace_inode`. Attempted to fill in the gaps on what is needed in order to add this capability.
summary.otherNotes: Clarification: According to @jeniawhite, this will require changes in osquery (fetching the `namespace_inode`).

issueDTO.title: Parse process config file based on the real file's type and not the extension
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Cloudbeat failed to parse a Kubelet process config file as it lacks the supported extensions (JSON/YAML), even though the file is indeed a yaml file.

```
09:33:10.542 elastic_agent.cloudbeat [elastic_agent.cloudbeat][info] Using etc/eks/ecr-credential-provider/ecr-credential-provider-config as a configuration file for process kubelet
09:33:10.548 elastic_agent.cloudbeat [elastic_agent.cloudbeat][error] Failed to parse file configuration for process kubelet, error -  type is not supported
```

**Preconditions**
8.7.0-SNAPSHOT
Install the KSPM - EKS integration

**To Reproduce**
Write the exact actions one should perform in order to reproduce the bug.
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install agents and observe fleet UI logs, the error should appear.


**Expected behavior**
Cloudbeat should be able to parse YAML/JSON files even if the file's name lacks the proper extension, which can be handled by detecting the actual mime type of the file.

issueDTO.title: Add ELB and ECR image to the EKS cluster deployment
issueDTO.description:
**Motivation**
Currently, we don't have visibility on whether we generate findings for the AWS-related fetchers (ELB/ECR) in the `cis_eks` benchmark.
When our terraform deployment creates the EKS cluster, it does not configure a Load balancer, and the agent image is not pulled from ECR, as a result, findings for ELB and ECR are not being generated.
For example, our long-running env doesn't produce those findings and might cause us to miss degradations in those areas.

**Definition of done**
As part of our terraform deployment:
- [ ] Push an updated image of the agent to a public ECR.
- [ ] Create the EKS cluster with an LB

issueDTO.title: Lint `deploy/` shell scripts with shellcheck
issueDTO.description:
**Motivation**
[Shellcheck](https://www.shellcheck.net/) is a very popular shell script linter, its usage is recommended as a best practice when developing shell scripts.

Expand the shellcheck linter usage to other scripts in our repo, especially the ones that are used by users, like [deploy.sh](https://github.com/elastic/cloudbeat/blob/main/deploy/deployment-manager/deploy.sh).

For example, one potential problem I see in that script is that the `set -e` option is not set which means that the script will continue even when commands start failing. But, enabling that option is not enough because we are affected by rule [SC2155](https://www.shellcheck.net/wiki/SC2155) in our variable exports.

**Definition of done**
What needs to be completed at the end of this task
- [ ] Expand pre-commit file regex to include more files
- [ ] Evaluate and fix or ignore failures

**Related tasks/epics**
Shellcheck introduced in https://github.com/elastic/cloudbeat/pull/1357
comments: Closed by: https://github.com/elastic/cloudbeat/pull/1534
Not all scripts are linted yet, re-opening
- [ ] Include `deploy/deployment-manager/` scripts as well
It will be covered by https://github.com/elastic/cloudbeat/pull/1568

repository.name: cloudbeat

issueDTO.title: CIS K8s boolean cli arguments rules perform case sensitive check
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
CIS K8s rules:

`1.2.18`: Verify that the `--profiling` argument is set to `false` for `kube-apiserver`.
`1.3.2`: Verify that the `--profiling` argument is set to `false` for `kube-controller-manager`.
`1.4.1`: Verify that the `--profiling` argument is set to `false` for `kube-scheduler`.
`2.2`: Verify that the `--client-cert-auth` argument is set to `true` for `etcd`.

Evaluate to fail when the boolean values are `True`/`False`. 

**Preconditions**
A k8s cluster with updated the mentioned arguments in control plane to have `True`/`False` value.
Config files:
  * `/etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml`
  * `/etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-controller-manager.yaml`
  * `/etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-scheduler.yaml`
  * `/etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml`

**To Reproduce**
Write the exact actions one should perform in order to reproduce the bug.
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install kspm in this cluster


**Expected behavior**
Those rules should pass with boolean values in this format `True`/`False`.


Technically the cli boolean flag parsing happens with `strconv.ParseBool` in all cases.

  * [k8s](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/546f7c30860dcdecb75c544230a1b7cdf5bd5958/staging/src/k8s.io/component-base/cli/flag/sectioned.go#L38) uses the library [spf13/pflag](https://github.com/spf13/pflag/blob/d5e0c0615acee7028e1e2740a11102313be88de1/bool.go#L21).
  * [etcd](https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/blob/9f8756b90de5f6d04931feb0ac0dc91493cd8b61/server/embed/config.go#L654) uses go [flag](https://cs.opensource.google/go/go/+/master:src/flag/flag.go;l=134) package.

[`strconv.ParseBool`](https://cs.opensource.google/go/go/+/master:src/strconv/atob.go;l=10) accepts these values:
  * `"1"`, `"t"`, `"T"`, `"true"`, `"TRUE"`, `"True"` as `true`
  * `"0"`, `"f"`, `"F"`, `"false"`, `"FALSE"`, `"False"` as `false`

repository.description: Analyzing Cloud Security Posture
repository.name: cloudbeat

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to evaluate the CIS K8s rules and ensure that they pass when the boolean values are set correctly, specifically with `--profiling` and `--client-cert-auth` arguments.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires that the boolean values are in the correct format (`True`/`False`) and that the rules pass when the values are set correctly.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue is related to the parsing of boolean values using `strconv.ParseBool` in k8s and etcd, which accepts values in specific formats.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to CIS K8s boolean cli arguments rules performing case sensitive checks, specifically with `--profiling` and `--client-cert-auth` arguments.

**Out of scope**

**Related tasks/epics**
Reference related issues and epics

issueDTO.title: Warm Welcome SSOC 2025 Contributors
issueDTO.description:
# 🌐 Welcome to **Project-AIML** ??? DataSentience-AIML 💡

### *Part of Social Summer of Code 2025* 🚀

**???Integrating AI across Medical, Financial, LLM, and Real-World Applications???**

---

## 👋 Hello Contributor! Welcome to the family 🎉

We???re excited to have you as part of **Social Summer of Code** and this impactful AI project!
This repository focuses on solving real-world challenges using **deep learning**, **reinforcement learning**, and **intelligent automation**, with applications in:

* 🏥 **Healthcare**
* 💰 **Finance**
* 🧠 **Natural Language Processing (LLMs)**
* 🌐 **Real-World Systems & Web Apps**

Let???s build something meaningful ??? together! 💫

---

## 🛠??? How to Contribute

1. **Fork** the repo and clone it to your local machine.
2. Browse **Issues** and comment **"I want to work on this"** to get it assigned.
3. Work on your feature or fix, then submit a **Pull Request (PR)**.
4. Wait for review, and stay engaged with the community.

---

## 🏷??? Issue Labels for SSoC

| Label               | Meaning                                               |
| ------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- |
| `SSoC-beginner`     | Easy issues perfect for first-timers 💫               |
| `SSoC-intermediate` | Medium-level tasks needing moderate experience        |
| `SSoC-advanced`     | Complex issues or model integration                   |
| `bug`               | Fix errors or malfunctioning features                 |
| `enhancement`       | Improve or extend existing functionality              |
| `documentation`     | Improve or update README / guides                     |
| `web-app`           | Build UI/frontend or integrate backend APIs (??? bonus) |
| `LLM`               | Work with transformer-based language models           |
| `domain-medical`    | Healthcare-related models or pipelines                |
| `domain-finance`    | Finance-related AI/ML components                      |

---

## ??? Merge (PR) Standards

> 🧠 Please follow these simple steps to ensure your PR is accepted smoothly!

* PR must be linked to an open issue (`Closes #issue_number` in description).
* Add clear and meaningful title (e.g., `Added BMI Prediction Module for HealthApp`).
* Code should be clean, modular, and well-commented.
* Pass linting and basic test cases (if applicable).
* For UI changes, attach screenshots or demo links.
* Documentation must be updated (README, docstrings, etc.).

---

## 🌟 Points & Recognition (SSoC Scoring)

| Contribution                   | Points                         |
| ------------------------------ | ------------------------------ |
| Fixing Bugs                    | 10                             |
| Adding New Features            | 20                             |
| LLM/NLP Feature Implementation | 25                             |
| Domain-Specific AI (Med/Fin)   | 25                             |
| **Web App / Frontend Dev**     | **30** ??? (priority/high value) |
| Documentation Improvements     | 5                              |

> 🏆 **Top contributors** will be recognized on the project page, and receive shoutouts from mentors.

---

## 🤝 Community & Support

* Join our [[Discussion Forum](https://github.com/PRIYANSHU2026/DataSentience-AIML/issues/new#)](#) or reach out via Issues for any help.
* Stay active and respectful ??? open source is about collaboration! ??????

---

## 🚀 Let???s make AI for all ??? one PR at a time!

We???re truly grateful to have you onboard with **Social Summer of Code**. Let???s innovate, contribute, and grow together! 🌱

---

Would you like this saved as a markdown file (`CONTRIBUTING.md`) or integrated into your GitHub README?

issueDTO.title: Add support for resetting the local persistent cache
issueDTO.description:
#1019 made the local persistent caching feature of gittuf generally available. Users can initialize the cache with `gittuf cache init`.

We should add functionality to reset the local cache in case of issues or if the user would like to disable the cache. This should mostly be just adding a new command and methods in https://github.com/gittuf/gittuf/blob/main/internal/cache/cache.go#L51 to delete the cache ref.
comments:
Hey @patzielinski ,

I wanted to clarify if there???s no need to handle multiple cache references at this point, as I noticed that the `gittuf cache init` command currently creates only a single cache reference. 

Considering this, it seems like the `reset` functionality only needs to deal with this single cache reference for removal (as of now).

I think @shivpratikhande is correct, the gittuf cache init command creates only a single cache reference (refs/gittuf/cache). Therefore, implementing the reset functionality to handle just this single reference is appropriate for now.
Given the lack of activity, I'm curious if I could contribute to this.

```
def get_deepseek_r1_question_template_answer(question: CodeGenerationProblem):
    # Following modifications from: https://github.com/fanqiwan/FuseAI/blob/main/FuseO1-Preview/code_evaluation/lcb_runner_cq/prompts/code_generation.py
    prompt = "You will be given a question (problem specification) and will generate a correct Python program that matches the specification and passes all tests.\n\n"
    prompt += f"Question: {question.question_content}\n\n"
    if question.starter_code:
        prompt += f"{PromptConstants.FORMATTING_MESSAGE_WITH_STARTER_CODE}\n"
        prompt += f"```python\n{question.starter_code}\n```\n\n"
    else:
        prompt += f"{PromptConstants.FORMATTING_WITHOUT_STARTER_CODE}\n"
        prompt += f"```python\n# YOUR CODE HERE\n```\n\n"
    prompt += f"\nInclude your code inside ```YOUR CODE HERE```.\n<???Assistant???>\n<think>"
    return prompt
```

issueDTO.title: Is `argparse.SUPPRESS` needed for anything in `def create_cli_parser`?
issueDTO.description:
Maybe it at least affects error message in case of invalid CLI options?

Either put a comment explaining why it's needed, or remove if not.
comments:
```
>>> import argparse
>>> parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(argument_default=argparse.SUPPRESS)
>>> parser.add_argument('--foo')
_StoreAction(option_strings=['--foo'], dest='foo', nargs=None, const=None, default='==SUPPRESS==', type=None, choices=None, required=False, help=None, metavar=None)
>>> parser.add_argument('bar', nargs='?')
_StoreAction(option_strings=[], dest='bar', nargs='?', const=None, default='==SUPPRESS==', type=None, choices=None, required=False, help=None, metavar=None)
>>> parser.parse_args(['--foo', '1', 'BAR'])
Namespace(foo='1', bar='BAR')
>>> parser.parse_args([])    ### HERE
Namespace()
>>> parser2 = argparse.ArgumentParser(argument_default=argparse.SUPPRESS)
>>> parser2 = argparse.ArgumentParser()
>>> parser2.add_argument('--foo')
_StoreAction(option_strings=['--foo'], dest='foo', nargs=None, const=None, default=None, type=None, choices=None, required=False, help=None, metavar=None)
>>> parser2.add_argument('bar', nargs='?')
_StoreAction(option_strings=[], dest='bar', nargs='?', const=None, default=None, type=None, choices=None, required=False, help=None, metavar=None)
>>> parser2.parse_args(['--foo', '1', 'BAR'])
Namespace(foo='1', bar='BAR')
>>> parser2.parse_args([])   ### vs HERE
Namespace(foo=None, bar=None)
```

Fork point for ... is overridden to @~~ (commit abcdef).
